text:
Gotta respond to Dee M. and her critique of the lady bartender at Sam's Cafe.  I've been served by Amanda about 100 times over the last few years, and never once has she shown me poor customer service or a bad attitude.  She's about the best bartended in Phoenix, so go check her out some time!

As for the restaurant itself, the food is pretty tasty.  Pancho's enchilada's are my staple, but you can't really go wrong with anything there.  Happy Hour is also great - several good food and drink specials.  My favorite drinking place at the AZ Center by far!

Best TexMex in the valley! The chips and salsa are home made and probably the best I have ever eaten. I had shrimp tacos which were delicious, staff was very friendly and down to earth.....if you ate downtown give them a try.

To start the service was terrible. Total dining experience took 2.5 hours when it should have taken and hour or hour and a half. Not only did it take forever to get our food ordered, to come out and even longer to get the check when we were more than ready to go. Food was okay however later that night I discovered something was very bad. I got food poisoning from the salmon Caesar salad and was sick for almost a good 24 hours. Bad experience all around.

I have been here twice and only to the Bar Area. 

The bartenders know their drinks and you are offered Chips & Salsa which are warm and amazing. The chips are dusted with some seasoning and you get a chipotle based salsa.
The menu has many options and their table side guacamole is very good and fresh - get it if you can. The only downside is that they cannot make my favorite drink is a Michelada (also known as a Red Beer) and consist of a Mexican beer, lime, spices and Clamato and salted glass . For some reason they don't carry Clamato and I usually order it with a bloody mix instead which is my that great but will do. They also don't have any Hefeweizen at all which is odd but this is the reason for my 4 stars - I'm limited on my favorite drink selections

Another good meal at Canyon cafe.  The 3 kinds of chips was a great start.  We almost asked for another bowl of the chips.  YUM. My husband and I both had the fish tacos.  Also delicious.  The waitress brought the check with a white chocolate treat.  Nice way to end the meal.  Wish they still had the bison tacos.

Went with my son during a rainy Super Bowl afternoon.  Due to the inclement weather it was pretty dead.

The best part were the chips and salsa and margaritas.  Ordered table side home made guacamole which was very tasty.  

Disappointed with the tacos.  Tacos??? Really, lol.

Fajitas were just, "ok".

In my opinion, a great place to go to for margaritas and chips and salsa and that's it.

All the way from the amazing mix of flavored chips and salsa to the meal to the view and service you can't go wrong here! This was by far one of the best meals I've had. I got the salmon and it had a pine nut pesto serve over mashed sweet potatoes with spinach sautéed with candied pecans on top.  Freddie was my server and she was absolutely a charm! Very attentive and sweet as can be! I wished we had a location in the Dallas Texas area, I would be here weekly! They truly know how to please the eye, the mouth and the heart! Job well done Canyon Cafe!!!

Best lunch ever!!! We ate here 4 times while in Phoenix. It was an easy 5 minute walk from the convention center within the shopping/eating center. Get the stuffed pepper (Carnitas Relleno), the tuna, stuffed chicken breast, and/or chicken quesadilla. You won't regret it!! Also, they serve AMAZING chips (thick homemade sweet potato, tortilla, and baked chips) with the best homemade salsa. And the prices can't be beat for what you get!!
Very friendly and helpful but could not eat there because of allergies gluten and soy. Recommended nearby place instead.
Great portions and good food. Stayed for a week near by. Probably ate here 4 times in a week. The southwest Cobb salad is beyond delicious. Great happy hour 4-7 everyday. Highly recommend.

Went on a random trip to downtown Phoenix and decided to eat lunch at this place.  Be careful of the chips & salsa appetizer- they're bound to get you hooked before the actual meal comes out! I got the salmon flautas which had a fruit salsa topping.  It was greasy and not too flavorful, but the salsa balanced out the greasiness.  My friend had the bbq burger and the black fish tacos, and they enjoyed their dishes as well.  It's not outstanding, but a nice place to eat at with a nice view.  They also gave a peppermint white chocolate tamale dessert for free at the end of my meal! Only thing I didn't like were the birds outside sitting on the tables and pecking at crumbs on the floor!

The free chips and salsa was great!  It was hard to stop eating the various types of warm chips and chunky, fresh salsa.  The shrimp tacos were delicious! The nice free dessert (banana burrito) from checking in made it a perfect lunch!

I really liked this place they will definitely see me again. Often! The atmosphere outside was fantastic, noise levels were jovial while we could easily converse without shouting - just right.

The food was amazing. People at two other tables around us exclaimed Wow! When receiving their orders. 

Worth a visit.

Great blackened Tilapia!
Almost like the Blackened Mahi I regularly eat at Papadiux. 
Visited this restaurant while attending the Infusionsoft ICON15 Conference. 
It's 2 minutes walking distance from the Convention Center.

This place was interesting, to say the least. 

The location is absolutely beautiful! It's in the Arizona Center and the scenery makes the dining experience so much better. 

The meal: it started off with some tortilla chips and salsa. The chips were something new for me, they had some sort of seasoning on them, but they were good!

I ended up getting the chile-rubbed sirloin with the double mash. The steam itself seemed a little dry, but it was still delicious. The mash potatoes had a similar seasoning as the chips, but seemed to be mixed with sweet potatoes too. I wasn't a fan, this took me by surprise.

The flavors are good, but definitely a little bit different!

Our server, Jennifer, was amazing. She was kind, attentive, and friendly!

Everything about this place is wonderful!! I love the huge windows and outdoor patio! Gorgeous! Their food is amazing everything from the chips (there are about 5 different chips in the basket) and salsa to dessert! They have some of the best margaritas in town! Yum! My favorite thing on the menu is the goat cheese stuffed chicken with roaster red pepper sauce! This is to die for!!
Good place. Not the most exciting food, but solid quality. The table-side fresh guacamole was a knockout!

I have always enjoyed eating at Sam's (now Canyon) from when they had their Biltmore location...the Pancho's Enchiladas are my favorite! However I went to their downtown location with my 4 month old daughter today to meet some friends for lunch and they do NOT have a diaper changing station in their restroom. Was pretty disappointed and won't be returning if it is a family meal.

Great happy hour.  Complimentary and yummy chips and salsa.  Good price on my favorite dish...the black and blue quesadilla.  Plus, there is always at least one beer worth drinking at happy hour pricing.
We had several of their specials in our group and they were all fabulous!!  Our server was incredible and service was great!! Going back before we leave one more time!!

Ate here with a group of work associates while staying across the street for a conference. Service was very good - our waiter handled the large group with ease, which doesn't always happen.

The chips and salsa are unlike any I've had anywhere else and they were totally addictive! My end of the table demolished our bowl in minutes and then grabbed the one from the other end. 

The entrees left a bit to be desired, however. Lots of seafood - which just doesn't seem right in the desert. I would have liked more traditionally tex-mex dishes to choose from as I eventually settled on the enchilada and carnitas platter, which was OK. 

All things considered, it was a good experience and I'm sure I'll be back next time business brings me to Phoenix.

I went to Sam's Cafe with my boyfriend last week, & it was amazing. Great happy hour prices & THE BEST margaritas of my life. For $2. 

Our waitress was extremely attentive, always refilling our waters, chips, margaritas. My chicken tacos were incredible! And he loved the shrimp tacos so much that we actually ate at Sam's twice more before returning home to Oregon. 

In a state known for its southwestern dishes, Sam's Cafe sets the bar high for Tex-Mex cuisine.

I love this place and have eaten her more times than I can count.  Anything with their green chili pork is fantastic.  The steak and blue cheese quesadilla is amazing.  As several others haven mentioned the chips and salsa are quite tasty.

This is my second review of the Canyon Café; the first was the result of a very disappointing visit earlier this month due to their service.  I reviewed on Trip Advisor and Yelp and asked the management to please read the many reviews online about their horrible service and take notice.  They DID!

Not only did I receive a response to my posting from the Manager, but I was invited to make a return visit.  His response was not defensive or full of excuses but a sincere desire to make things right, which I appreciated.  I will admit to sending two other friends down there to see how they were treated after I received the Manager's reply saying they had made some changes.  They each told me the service was very good so I replied to the Manager with my number and said we would be giving them a return visit for our wedding Anniversary.

When I received the call from them to make my reservation, Laura was very informed of my review and said it made her shudder when she realized what had happened.  I was surprised that she knew the details but apparently, everyone - from the Manager on Duty, Steven, to chef Thomas to waitress Cheryl - all were well informed!  Cheryl thanked us for making them aware of the problem and said they had made some changes to assure their customers didn't leave unhappy any longer.  Thomas - who'd had no part in the problems before - shared his passion for the restaurant and made a good case for how they are a family there and all care about the restaurant's being well perceived by the public.  

Our experience there was delightful!  The food was the expected excellence we've always enjoyed and the service was exemplary!  Thank you, Cheryl!  We received a lot of personal attention but noticed that the other diners were given the same.  This is what we wanted to see because as long time customers, we didn't want people to turn away from them and see them go into a decline like so many restaurants.

Hats off to Canyon Café for listening to their customers and making the necessary changes to assure a great dining experience.  All done with a great attitude, too!  So please count on our continued return for many more enjoyable visits at the Canyon Café!  Nice job!

I had dinner here at the end of a long week of conference meetings. Compared to the fast food, food court, and hotel fare I'd eaten throughout the week before, this was a fabulous meal. Compared to any Tex-Mex restaurant in Texas, however, this was pretty bleh. So, for travelers that know good Mexican or Tex-Mex food, you may be disappointed with the flavors here--but given your few eating options in Phoenix, I'd definitely recommend it.

Primary food gripes: the salsa was smoky tasting and so dark as to almost look black. The carnitas in my chimichanga were dry and burnt. Little spice or flavor to the overall dish.

Positives: Their top shelf margarita was excellent. Just excellent. Also, one of my fellow diners loved the stuffed chicken dish. 

Service-related: Attentive, friendly service, if a little overly so. Weak or no A/C on in the restaurant while we ate. In June. Not awesome.
What a great menu and patio... The commemorativo margarita is great...
The service was great but the food was just okay. Nothing super great, I had the special- it was some kind of tenderloin but it was dry. Good margaritas!
The food was very innovative and delicious. I ordered stuffed chicken that had goat cheese in it. The nachos were also delicious with the salsa. Definitely recommend this place.

The food was amazing. The chips were different than I've ever had. They had different spices on them which were delicious. We also had the roasted artichoke queso dip which was amazing. I also had the street tacos which were delicious. The service on the other hand was a different story. Our waitress Denise M was so rude. I had to ask multiple times to get my water refilled and she was rushing us with ordering and the check. Very disappointed in the service but the food was delicious. If you decide to try this restaurant out hopefully you get a different server because the food was delicious.
Great flavor, reasonable prices and good service. Enjoyed happy hour margaritas and a delicious carnitas plate. Salsa and chips were surprisingly different. Would definitely recommend

This place came highly recommended by my son.  So we buzzed into this neat little complex.  Found the restaurant and sat outside watching the nursing students go by.  I ordered a house special margarita, that they will only sell two of to you.  The drink was made out of fresh juices and a healthy pour of tequila. Wow it was delicious. 

A unique basket of chips was dropped off at out table.  Different kinds of chips with a great spice on them and what appeared to be a restaurant made salsa.  Absolutely delicious.  Really, fantastic flavors in a great combination. 

Had a chimichangas for my meal.  It was really good as well.  Crunchy outside with a real intense flavored chicken inside.

I will without a doubt return next time I am in Phoenix.
Staff was rude and obnoxious. Also, they close very early no matter what their hours say. Never going back in there.

Don't often leave 1-star reviews but have no choice with this one. We went on a friends recommendation who went a day earlier, they had a great time but our experience was completely opposite.

The chips and guacamole were awesome but everything went sharply downhill after that. We waited about 45 minutes for our food (after finally complaining to the waitress and getting an eyeroll our food came out immediately). The food was mainly cold and the steak fajitas were rubbery. We all ate about half our plates and decided it was time for the check.

The restaurant was empty and waitress was nowhere to be seen for most of the night. Oh well.

I come to Phoenix for work a lot and this is always a place my co-workers and I come to when we're in town.  There's really nice outdoor seating with some misters to cool you down on a hot summer day. 

They always provide you with chips and salsa which are AH-MAY-ZING.  It's not your typical tortilla chips and salsa there's something extra special about these chips.  

It's your standard tex-mex cuisine.  I really like their shrimp taco's.  The carnitas platter was pretty good but the pork was a bit too salty for me.  Their fajitas are always good.  The salmon is also pretty good.  Those are the typical dishes I get when I go.  

When you end the meal they always give you white chocolate tamales to clean/cool your palate.  Always delish. ...

The place hasn't really disappointed me except for this past week when we purchased two pitchers of the Grand Canyon margaritas and there was more juice than there was tequila.  :-\  but other than that it's pretty good.
Ordered the stuffed chicken breast with goat cheese.I believe it was the Santa fe. It was absolutely amazing and delicious. The chips and salsa were a great taste prior to the main course.

Sam's Cafe at Arizona Center is a relaxed restaurant good for dinner or a weekend lunch. I've been underwhelmed by an entree or two (note: don't bother with the steak), but in general, the food is good. The margaritas are large and potent. They have a small but good selection of beers on tap. The chips and salsa are good. I enjoy their quesadillas and burgers. The patio is a great place to have a lazy Saturday afternoon drink with friends.

While I like Sam's Cafe well enough, I know some people who absolutely love it, so I can confidently say it is worth a visit.

Canyon Cafe was fantastic. We started with their awesome chips and table side Guac, which was very fresh. Then I had shrimp tacos. The lightly-breaded shrimp were bathed in a sweetish-spicy remoulade and topped with "margarita coleslaw," which was light and citrus-y. I savored every bite. Finished lunch with white chocolate tamales. We're only in town for a few days, but we'll probably even eat at Canyon Cafe again on this trip.

Our server was a little slow BUT, she was really nice and very helpful.  Our meal was excellent starting with their chip bowl that had a variety of chips in it and good salsa.  The meal was also really good.  I got the seafood flautas.  I would've finished it had I not filled myself up on the chip bowl.  They also bring out complimentary white chocolate tamales that tasted really good!  If they do that for all their customers, I can see why everyone comes back.

Was in Phoenix for a conference at the convention center.  No car, extreme heat, dead downtown.  This was across the street and one of two Mexican places in the area.  Had the naked chile relleno and the max limit (?) of two margaritas.  Chips and salsa were very good and different.  I suspect they used dried chiles.  The relleno was great.  Meat was tender, mushrooms and other veggies very flavorful.  Can't imagine why they feel a need to "limit" customers to two, but it was good.  Service was brusque but quick.

If you are in Phoenix for a convention, give this place a try. I took a group of 10 clients...they loved it. Nice southwest atmosphere, food was great! Service was great! For 10 people with drinks and a few deserts came out to $27 per person with the tip. Highly recommended!
Great chips and salsa. Never tried because it never came. Waited in hour at my table just to walk away. Good luck!

Excellent restaurant serving southwest menu. Lots of choices - you will have trouble deciding. Great margaritas - gotta try the Limit 2. Once you have one - you will understand its name! 

Service is excellent - never an empty water or ice tea glass! The tea is fresh brewed. We ordered all over the menu - several favorites - Fish Tacos and Crispy Shrimp Tacos were outstanding. Both cooked perfectly - the slaw is off the charts. 

The pork dishes are incredible. Location is a little challenging to find - in the middle of a small corner shopping plaza - across the street from the Sheraton. Two blocks from the Convention Center. 

Salsa is so fresh the tomatoes are still ripening in the bowl! Nice smoky flavor to salsa - also the chips are seasoned - really different and delish!

I love this place!!

The chips and salsa are fantastic, I couldn't stop eating them.  The food was excellent, the service was prompt and friendly, and even the desert was delicious (tres leches)!

We went on a Friday night and were one of the only ones in the restaurant, which surprised me.  We also ordered a margarita (one of the ones large enough to share) and it was perfectly prepared.

I look forward to coming here again and highly recommend giving it a shot if you haven't yet.  The free dessert Yelp coupon alone makes it worthwhile!
This is actually one of favorite restaurants ever, been coming since 1999 and they've only gotten better over the years, Guys: great first-date place!!

Fantastic southwest food! You want something fresh, tasty, and reasonably priced go to Canyon Cafe! The canyon classic burger is perfect! Cheddar jalapeño bun can't be beat!! Guacamole made to order right in front of you! Can't beat that!

Here at Sheraton and walked over for dinner. Ordered Pablo's enchiladas (2 orders) and a spinach and mushroom quesadilla. 
Negative: All was originally served room temperature at best...came to us within 5 minutes of original order and we were told it was "cooked to order." Server was okay...he did return the original plates to kitchen and bring out somewhat fresher food...microwave warm. Service is slow at best. 
Positive: ambiance was nice. Server was kind enough re: our complaints of stale/rewarded food. Sauce on enchiladas (which is what this restaurant is apparently known for) was tasty. 
Overall: I would not return. Too many options for southwestern food nearby. The restaurant was busy (not overly, but steady) during our visit which would suggest food was being freshly prepared...which is certainly was not.

Pretty good food. Pop in here for a quick lunch or a quick dinner. I wouldn't plan on coming here for a nice dinner while on vacation, but after a long day of sightseeing, if you want to just sit down and get some Mexican and a few coronas without having to go back to the hotel and shower and get dressed up, this place will do.

Two! Not one,  but two roaches crawling on the table. Came in, sat and ordered then here comes a Roach crawling on the table then another! Not sure if the solar flares, the full moon, or the fact that it's Friday the 13th had anything to do with it,  but the fact that it was my first time there, the roaches made it my last time there! And the fact that the booth seating with the huge square pillars makes for an uncomfortable setting. And the energy is not good,  very off! Also, the roaches were small, meaning there are more, probably a nest! Roaches don't come out during the day unless there's an infestation! Wouldn't recommend eating here!

Went in about 430pm folks were friendly service was prompt. I had the chicken enchiladas, my friend had the Canyon Carnita Relleno. They were both outstanding. The chips and salsa were great. We travel for a living and have sampled several Mexican restaurants over the years, this one is certainly in the top 10%. Enchiladas came with a nice green salad. Service was excellent. I will definitely return. This is a slightly different take on Mexican food, not you usual bland fare.

First time in Phoenix, the Hyatt Regency recommended us to go here for some great Mexican food and that we had - along with some great 2-limit margaritas! Our server Frederica was so great! We told her about how we were going to drive all over the state and site see in the days to come, we pulled out a map and she gave us the best routes to drive, best scenic views, she said if we needed more information she'd call her dad and we could ask him questions. I'm glad we had her as a server and we're so glad we listened to her advice!

I have been to this place multiple times because of the good food. Yesterday I had tuna with rice, vegetables and avocado. The food was yummy and the waitress was excellent. When I checked in on yelp I noticed the free desert with an entree promo. How exciting for somebody who LOVES sweets. I ordered a cheesecake with caramel sauce to go. Very disappointed to say, the cake was old!!!I tried a few bites to give it another try but just couldn't do it. Changing my rating to 3 stars. I realize that the dessert was free, but that is not the reason to serve somebody an old product....

So we came here for drinks after work, and the sign says "half price Margaritas." After we order the first round we find out the happy hour is only if you order drinks from the bar. Really? That first round was really weak, by the way. After bringing this to the waiter's attention, he "checked" with his manager and gave us the happy hour price. Needless to say, we didn't order any more drinks from him and he made himself scarce. Would have ordered food, if he came back and checked on us. Ever. Gave two stars because he bumped down the price (as he should) and the chips and salsa were good.
We were a group of 23 for dinner our poor waiter had no help. We were served a round of drinks and it was an hour after before we were asked to place our orders. The food was terrible!

Giving a one star is very generous. Ate there last night for one reason, the fabulous location. To start off there was a 45 minute wait and the restaurant was half empty, that was the first sign something was not right. Second sign, the most rude bartender on the face of the earth and we still stuck it out. Finally got to our table and the bad adventure begun. To start off, the tortilla chips were just covered with salt and seasoning spice, you have to clean them off, one at a time. The salsa is nothing but tostitos southwest sauce they've sold for years, just garbage. As for the service, after the 6th time the waitress telling you your food will be right out and 1 hour and 10 minutes gone by, who really wanted to eat ? We should have walked out and headed to Taco Bell for a better meal, enough said. As for the Superbowl visitors, I'm from Phoenix this is a no go, don't ruin your night.....................

How good is Sam's? Well, I just got back from eating dinner here, and I couldn't think of anything I wanted to do more than write this review -- that's how good it is. 

I'm in town for business and a buddy who lives in the area suggested this place for dinner tonight, and boy am I glad he did! 

Let me start with the ambiance. Very nicely decorated and furnished in the Southwestern style that is common down here but done nicely, not gaudy or tacky in any way. There is a nice outside patio seating area, however considering I'm from Seattle and the temp was still pushing 100 degrees, we opted to sit inside.

Once we were seated, we were tempted to order the "Limit-2" margaritas that they are apparently famous for, but decided against it. After taking our drink order, the waitress brought us a basket of chips and a bowl of salsa.

Let me stop right here.

I knew just from looking at them, that these were no ordinary chips . Not only were they a mixture of different types of chips (regular tortillas, sweet potato, and wontons), but each type was topped in a different seasoning -- my favorite being the wonton chips topped in seasoning and some powdered sugar, giving it a sweet and spicy flavor at the same time. Amazing. I asked the waitress what the seasoning but I swear they were laced with cocaine as well. Hands down the best chips and salsa I've ever had in my life. I would go back just for that!

Once we overcame the confusion of what the "Super Salad" was (it turns out she was asking if I wanted soup OR salad), I ordered the Pueblo House Salad to start with. It was a very nice sized salad (could easily have been shared by two people if someone wanted to), and delicious with their honey chipotle vinaigrette dressing.

For the main course, I opted for the Santa Fe Stuffed Chicken Breast, which came off the "Sam-Mex" section of the menu. According to the menu, "Sam-Mex" was created by their executive chef with "the influence of Mexican, Spanish, Native American and American Southwest Cultures." The chicken breast was stuffed with herb-goat cheese and served over a roasted red pepper cream sauce with a pine nut & cilantro pesto, grilled asparagus and southwest rice.

Words cannot describe the amazing fusion of these different flavors as they combined into one superbly mind blowing dish.

I'll be honest, it was hard to concentrate on the conversation with my buddy as I was distracted each time I took a bite -- but don't let him know I said that!
 
At the end of the meal, as we opted not to order dessert (or the crazy margarita), we were treated to what the waitress referred to as "white chocolate tamales," compliments of the chef. Of course, know that I have read some of the other reviews on here, it seems that everyone gets these little treats, but whether the chef really intended for us to specifically have them or not was a mute point after tasting them -- a great finishing touch on an amazing meal. 

While I don't often get down to this part of the country, I will always have fond memories of this little "cafe" called, Sam's.
Absolutely the worst service I've ever seen. We waited for a half hour before grabbing a waitress.

This is a decent place. I came here some time ago because I had a Restaurant.com certificate, and the BF and I needed to use it up. 

The best part were the margaritas- tasty and lethal. I can't remember what I got, only that it had coconut in it. It shouldn't have worked, but it did! 

The food itself was... so-so. It was edible, nothing to write home about. The service was good, and the ambience lovely. We went in the fall and sat on the patio.

I wouldn't come out of my way to dine here, but if you were in the neighborhood during happy hour, it's definitely worth stopping in.

I have been to this place a couple of times once for dinner and a couple of times for happy hour. And I love it. The servers are friendly, the place is beautiful, the best part is the outside patio. The only two negative things are the small bar area (happy hour is only in the bar) and the birds. The birds are cute, very chatty and will join you at your table to try and share your chips.

The food was great, I got the enchiladas which were tasty and I asked to change the side and the waiter was more then happy to let me do that. A friend got the Tuna salad which she enjoyed. I am not a fish person but she let me try her tuna and it was actually pretty good. The chips that come to your table are okay, I'm not a fan of the sweet potato chips, the texture and taste just do not work for me. So when I go I ask if I can just get corn tortilla chips, and they are happy to do that too. The salsa is a red smokey salsa which is good, but you can ask for green salsa which is just as good.. maybe better

The best part of this place is the Happy hour. The drinks are cheap and tasty. The best is the Grand Canyon Margarita which a mixture of orange, cranberry and prickly pear juices, its strong and only 3 bucks. The regular margaritas are excellent, on mondays that have a 10 dollar pitcher deal, a friend and I were able to get three each out of the pitcher. Good thing she lives in walking distance to the place. 

Another good thing about the happy hour is the food. The bar has its own list of items in addition to the restaurants main menu. The best thing on that list is the chicken nachos, so good, best nachos I've had in a long time. Another is the cheese crisp with carnitas, very tasty.  Most of the items on this menu are around five dollars, and for five dollars you get a lot of food enough for two. 

I would highly recommend this place.

What a lovely lunch experience!  I had a carnitas-stuffed breaded pepper with a rich, creamy sauce...was almost sad when the meal ended. A complimentary small dessert of white chocolate-stuffed corn husks was a very nice surprise. I was too full to "unlock" the dessert listed here on Yelp and, so my friendly server, Cheryl, suggested I come back for it later - I think I'll take her up on that offer, because Happy Hour looks great!  :-)

Great ambience of fun, somewhat outdoor seating, water play and a cocktails. Chips and salsa was very good. The wait staff was very friendly and accomodating. We experienced as a couple and a large group, both times were amazingly friendly. Dining experience was great, food is good, however skip the calamari as it was cut thicker and chewy. I would return to this restaurant.

I used to eat here every week, but got tired of overcooked steaks. Thought I would give them another chance tonight but sorry I did. After braving the construction that is the AZ center, had another overcooked steak. Ordered MR & it came out Med to MW. Service at the bar also sucked. Never asked how the food was (after sending out the wrong sides) and never offered to refill my drink.  Probably not going to return after this experience.

Margaritas were awesome! I ordered the crispy shrimp street taco platter and at first glance it wasn't what I expected however they turned out great! I will definitely be returning and recommend to my friends.

My husband and I love this place. The food is not only great but beautifully presented! The staff and management (Tony) work hard to ensure customers are having a great experience. The construction downtown makes it tricky to get to restaurant, but it's well worth it. Their happy hour (4-6:00) drinks and appetizers are a great value and tasty.

I wish I could give it 0 starts! I had a reservation there and when I walked in, there were about 20 other people waiting around the hostess stand. I walked up and said my name and what time my reservation was and the hostess said "yeah, he said that I can't seat anyone right now." I explained that I had a reservation, and was told that the other 20 people also had reservations, but "he said I can't seat anyone and I don't know when I will be allowed to seat." Now usually I'm okay with waiting, but the way that she said it irritated me - I have a background in the service industry and the first rule is to not put blame on another person - manager, servers, cooks, anyone! She could have said "unfortunately we aren't seating right now but once I know more I will let you know!"

Anyway, we went to the bar to see if we could at least get a drink while we waited. We're sitting, and sitting, and sitting, and sitting.... No acknowledgement or greeting from the bartenders. The only time we are acknowledged is when he says "chips?" We said no, we'd like some drinks, but he never got back to us. And the bar wasn't even busy!! While waiting there, I see the hostess seat two tables so I go up to her to see if they're seating now. She says, "well they're find with sitting and snacking on chips - are you? Because I don't have a server for you." Wow. How nice. No, we have a movie to catch and don't want to sit around and wait when you can get a server.

Basically, it was one of the worst experiences I've had - no table after we made a reservation, no acknowledgement at the bar, and no servers able to take us. Very impressed... not!

The struggle to find decent food and service in the #phx area was among one of my biggest struggles. The bartender was a bit brash at first and I felt rushed to make a decision on food & drink within a minute or two of sitting down. I ordered the wings and a coyote margarita. The wings were ok, pretty greasy & nothing spectacular. The margarita was good. When you arrive they give you complimentary chips and salsa. Don't get excited about it, because the chips were covered in heavy seasoning and salsa was very thick, smoky & heavy with adobo. After my appetizer and feelings about the chips and salsa, I didn't trust the place to deliver a decent meal. I had dinner elsewhere.

I really enjoyed the food, vibe, and had the best waitress ever!

The meal starts off with a free basket of chips+salsa. The salsa was different than you would expect to get normally. It wasn't spicy, but was actually super dark red, and it was served cold, which was great! Pair it with the assortment of chips they provide, and you could easily fill yourself up! You could tell they were homemade chips--a blue tortilla, normal corn tortilla with seasoning, and then a thicker sweeter churro-esque chip (which was my favorite).

The margaritas were delicious and were pretty strong without the taste of alcohol (major plus). Maybe it's because my alcohol tolerance has decreased significantly in the past few years, but after drinking 1/3 of it, I was hit with a surprising, pleasant buzz. I got the frozen mango margarita and my friend got the frozen raspberry one. 

We also ordered the table-made guac (where they have all the ingredients ready and bring it to your table side to mash it up in front of your eyes). It tasted good, just very ordinary as you would make it yourself at home. Nothing too special--wouldn't order it again.

I ordered the blackened tilapia with crawfish since it was something different than eating the normal Cajun crawfish. It had great flavors..unfortunately I was already full from the chips+salsa and guac.

All in all, the delicious food combo'd with the amazing service would have me definitely coming back on any future trip to Phoenix.
Really good margaritas but food is not that great. We have brought several friends on the weekend though because the environment can't be beat.

This is a good place to eat, but there are a few issues. The food is fresh and tasty (though neither authentic nor flavor rich). The premium margarita is excellent and the chips are a nice mix of fresh spicy styles. This is my third visit and I enjoyed the carnitas and enchilda platter. The enchiladas were great and had an unusual white sauce that really made the meal. The carnitas was well prepared, but a little fatty for my taste.  

As others have said, uneven service remains a challenge. The staff works hard, is friendly and trys to be attentive, but somehow come up just a bit short. Remembering details like split checks or dessert requests seem too much. If you have time to linger and people watch, none of this will be a problem. They seem to cater to conference visitors and folks coming downtown for the day. This may be your best option in the area. 

A final thought. While the desserts are not spectacular, they are good. The banana burrito stands our from the rest. It is tasty, a bit like bananas foster in a fried tortilla, but the use of Hershey's syrup leaves the experience falling short. And that summarizes the entire experience. Good for an area where you wouldn't expect good, but still short of what it might be.

Food was great, SW Cobb salad is amazing but the service was horrible. First the hostess sat me at the farthest end of the restaurant away from the few patrons that were there. Order was quickly taken and drinks and chips delivered very quickly, even the food came relatively fast but after that one person came by in the next 25 minutes to refill water until the waitress showed up and brought me my bill. $15 salad, I can get that somewhere else with much better service.

This restaurant was recommended to us by the hotel we were staying at.  Very disappointing .  Poor service, we actually had to get our menus ourselves.  Drinks were wrong after ordering- they were however corrected.  Food orders were messed up, arrived nearly 45 minutes later, all were cold, some were not even cooked all the way through.  We even had to return the chicken salad twice as it was made wrong, nothing special about it just didn't want dressing.  No one ever came to check on us, no one apologized, nothing was comp'ed.  The young ladies at the hostess stand were not very helpful either to our waitress who was clearly trying her best but over her head.  Not a good experience - go somewhere else.

I treated my mom and aunt to lunch. The restaurant was pretty empty but we were advised that the restaurant was booked from 4pm until close. That would've been an acceptable response if it wasn't 2 in the afternoon. We were told we could sit at the bar ( 6-8 people were already seated and being obnoxiously loud) or at the bar tables ( which were filled with plates and glasses from the last patrons). The hostess and manager ( assuming) seemed annoyed by the fact that we asked why we couldn't sit at the plethora of empty tables, to clean the tables around the bar and explanation as to why no one wanted to help. Visiting with a convention and being treated the way we were makes me EXTREMELY unhappy and wouldn't recommend anyone visit this establishment. 
The only saving grace is Sal. He was super helpful.

The food and drinks here never disappoint ! 
Chips and salsa are the reason why we go. No place in the valley that has chips like these. There is a margarita that they only serve you no more than two that is soooo sooo sooo good, and they are right on the no more than two! Service is always friendly and attentive. Unfortunately the place has gone down hill since the last time I was here. Booth seats not clean and worn out. Bathroom not so clean... ugh. 
Go for the food, look past the other stuff :) 
Yum!

Wow! Talk about a undiscovered gem. My husband and I frequent the movie theater here often and today I just had to have something to eat. Originally we were going around the corner to My big Fat Greek restaurant and I realized it was closed. My husband insisted we keep walking and we walked right into this place . Happy hour 7 days a week the bartender was just the sweetest woman giving us recommendations and answering all our questions. I will definitely be hungry next time we see a movie ;)

I highly recommend the Grand Canyon margarita and wings!

Went here for dinner with a group of 11. The service was great, the food was okay. I had the blackened fish tacos and the flavor was good, but it was nothing more than fish in a tortilla, nothing special. My favorite thing about this restaurant was the basket of chips they put on your table. They had everything from regular tortilla, deep fried, sweet pototao and blue corn chips. The margaritas were great too. I'd go back again because they do have a great outdoor patio, but the food is nothing memorable.

Great food.  We went with a large party and got great service.  Margaritas were very strong, so beware of how much you consume!  Fortunately, I wasn't driving and the metro is a short walk.  I could have made a meal of the chips and dip.  They had some sort of special seasoning that I couldn't quite place, but I loved them and ate way too many.  We sat outdoors and the weather was great.

I wish there was one of these in Atlanta!!Amazing food & drinks!  I had the Rico Rita (margarita made with rum) and it was awesome!!!  Then we did table side guacamole and it was fabulous!!! I loved their "chips" and salsa!  I had the street tacos (shrimp and carnitas) and they were delish.  They brought out some yummy white chocolate dessert too. 
My suggestion - sit outside & listen to the fountains!!
Absolutely delicious!! Queso dip and black and blue quesadilla were delightful. Highly recommend. For happy hour, you can't beat the price.

After having had some underwhelming meals at our hotel and around the convention district, this place was a BIG treat. The service was spot on, and we knew the meal was going to be good as soon as they brought out their special mixed chips and dark, smoky salsa. After our margaritas appeared (their special margaritas come out with a refill in the shaker), our entrees did not disappoint. Hearty chicken in the enchiladas and quesadilla, and our friend's intriguing 'naked' chili relleno. Portions were beyond generous, and thanks to checking in with Yelp we shared a dessert for free. We chose the banana burrito and had no regrets. Highly recommended. Sad that I won't be back in Phoenix any time soon - I'd definitely come back if this were in my city!!

I was totally disappointed from the food to the service the food was barely edible. the service was slow waitress did not know the menu or the ingredients. We ordered the  top shelf margarita we split it, it was nothing to write home about. The only thing on my plate that was absolutely good was the grilled vegetables they were crunchy and seasoned well. The talipia was bland and saturated with oil is very greasy yuck! 
The have a beautiful  view of the courtyard with lights.

If you're gonna eat tex-mex in the downtown phoenix area, this is your best bet. 

I typically go here every time I come to Phoenix, and it's pretty great. the outdoor seating with the Grotto view is really really gorgeous. 

The chips and salsa are FANTASTIC!!!! You get an assortment of chips and they are the best I've ever had. 

The blackened fish tacos set my mouth on FIRE. I had no idea they would be COVERED in chili powder. too extreme for me. 

Typically you get, white chocolate wrapped in a tamale leaf to cleanse your pallet after you are finish with your meal, which is one of my favorite parts of dinner ... but our waitress forgot :( ... definitely ask! 

I would say this is your typical "mexican/southwest" restaurant, where the entire menu is basically variations of taco salad, 10 different variations of quesadillas, and tacos of some sort, and 3 pages of different margaritas and drinks with "loco" in the name. 

Not too bad, not great either. I personally prefer the Greek place next door :)
Visited Sam's Cafe on the Urban Wine Walk. I recommend the white sangria!

Wow...what a nice surprise!  Chips and salsa were great, even though I usually prefer my salsa spicier than what is offered. Desert Fire Pasta was EXCELLENT, and sons loved their pork enchiladas and chicken quesadillas. Limit Two margarita was awesome (Top Shelf Conmemorativo).   Highly recommended - great food, reasonably priced, and outdoor seating wonderful!

I dined here three times in one month, each time with different groups. We all enjoyed the experience. The chips are made fresh on site and believe me, you can tell! 

Lots of outdoor seating right there by the palm trees and water fountains at Arizona Center. There are usually a few birds squawking and chirping in the background as well. No charge for this entertainment. 

Tried several dishes (NOT all in one sitting!), including tacos and enchiladas. All excellent. 

Full bar and indoor seating as well if desired. Friendly staff each visit. 

And here's a nice touch: they give out these corn husk-wrapped white chocolates as complimentary dessert. Make sure you unwrap those husks or you'll be in for a nasty surprise. 

The goods are on the inside. Not the outside. 

But on the inside? Savory, cool white chocolate. It tastes a bit like butter pecan ice cream (if anyone can even remember that flavor, which seems to have gone the way of vinyl albums and phone booths). 

Check out the Canyon Cafe. I believe you'll also become a fan.

After reading reviews I only ordered table side guacamole and a cheese quesadilla.  The chips were amazing and I thought the salsa was just okay.  Quesadilla was good. Service was slow but that was okay cuz I was there to enjoy a beautiful morning in Arizona!

I met some friends here for dinner on a Sunday night. The service is great! Our server gave great recommendation for food and drinks. I had the carnitas chile relleno and my guy had the chicken flautas that were both featured items. There are both tortilla and sweet potato chips with a delicious roasted salsa.  Just wished they did not require to pay for garage parking on the weekends downtown to hopefully bring more people to the center. If this restaurant was closer to my house I would go once a week.

Only gave three stars because the hostess would not seat us on the patio.
We were only there for drinks
I do say the margaritas were wonderful.
We ordered a pitcher and it was plenty for four, chips and salsa were delish.
Would definitely like to come back for food.

Great location. Food good. Came here on a Monday night about 10 minutes before closing and they accommodated us. Service was pretty quick and good. Outdoor seating available.

We ordered margaritas which were delicious. They bring the entire mixer, so you get about 1.5 - 2 glasses once you're finished drinking it.

We had the fish tacos and Avodo chicken pasta. Both tasted good and were cooked just right. Portions were fairly sizable. 

Dining space is fairly large and is good for groups.
Wow,  atmosphere and good food ! Amazing service.  The Pecan Salmon was out of this world,  and Open faced Chile was way killer.!

Omg this is a hidden gem
Great food and service 
Tony the manager and tonya the server was great
I ordered the black and blue quesadilla lots of stake and great flavor
My partner ordered the applewood salmon is was to die for
And the margaritas have a great taste and are potent lol 
Definitely will come back

Canyon Cafe is in the top five of favorite places to eat. My fiance and I recently celebrated our anniversary at Canyon Cafe.  

Pro: The chips and salsa rock my world! The entree's are delicious! The staff is friendly and efficient.  The ambiance is quiet and relaxed.

Con: The carnitas tacos are very greasy.

Canyon Cafe exceeds our expectations every time.  You go for dinner but you stay for the chips and salsa.  The chip basket includes sweet potato, blue corn, wonton, and regular tortilla chips.  The salsa is roasted and heavenly.  

Recommended: The bison burger, it is juicy and flavorful. The Verde Chicken enchiladas, love the sauce and chicken is tender.  The top shelf margarita, suggested to share but make sure to stir or the tequila will go straight to your head.

Can't wait to go back.  It's our little secret place that we enjoy because it's quiet and we usually leave feeling quite euphoric.

Here on business, staying at the downtown sheraton across the street from the restaurant. I've been here twice this week and the food and service have been great. Chips and salsa are a unique blend of sweet and salty and delicious. Great margaritas. Both I can only comment on the fajitas but they are amazing. I'd definitely recommend
Best Fajitas I've had!  Service was fast and friendly.  There was enough food easily for 2! The mall is under construction but it's worth the walk.

Stopped by here after a long day at the convention center. The tableside prepared guacamole was awesome as was the Chipotle salsa and variety of chips delivered to the table. The service was attentive but not annoying. Two of us had the naked relleno, one had flautas,  one had carnitas and another the corn chowder.  Everyone loved their meals that came out hot and nicely seasoned. Being from Colorado were really picky about our Mexican food so this was quite a treat.

This is a good stop for travelers to grab cheap food and enjoy some drinks.  

They start off with a nice helping of chips and salsa.  The chips were an assortment of corn, fried dough like, and whole grain chips.  The salsa was nice and spicy, a great start.  We also ordered guacamole which was creamy and oniony.   

We came at the time the servers switched off and areas, so we had 3 different servers, but after we had our final server, he was courteous and took care of us.

I had the desert fire pasta which was a big helping of spicy, cheesy penne pasta with shrimp.  It was really salty but still thought it was still good overall.

My co-worker had the fish tacos which was a nice large platter with black beans.  The sangria was delicious and you could have a choice of white or red.

No real complaints about this place - last time I was here, I was fairly pleased overall.  Chips and salsa were a treat, possibly only because I was really hungry.  Pretty good margarita, as well.  I guess the reason this place doesn't get more stars is the food - while not bad, it doesn't stand out much.  I've never had any problems with the service here, though I've never been really impressed by it either.

Eat on the patio - it's not a great patio, but it has a decent view of the Arizona Center's plaza.
Stood for 10 minutes waiting for someone to greet us.  Finally hostess greets us and first thing she states is sorry you will have to wait.  Half the restaurant is open!  Bad first impression

This place has so much promise, I need to come back and try it again!  The chips and salsa are spectacular.  The service was quite slow, but the restaurant was also quite busy.  It still took an hour and 15min and all I ordered was a salad.  Don't get the Calamari Salad if it is on special.  I should have known better than to get that at a TexMex restaurant, but lesson learned.  The dressing was very good, but the calamari was over-fried and the cucumbers were mushy and disgusting.  

Long story short, for lunch I had lettuce with good dressing and amazing chips and salsa for $15.  I saw plates of tacos go by that looked and smelled much better than what I was mulling through.  The waitress felt bad though, she could tell I was not enjoying my meal.  As a consolation prize I was hooked up with a delicious white chocolate tamale when I got my bill.  I will be back, I will choose more wisely, and hopefully things will be better!

A decent place for a businessman's lunch or a post-work Happy Hour for margaritas in the Arizona Center, but the food is a hit or miss, the servers are pretentious hipsters who could care less about their customers, and it's overpriced for very average Tex-Mex food in a city that has plenty of better Mexican food options. Good chips and salsa, but nothing else stands out.

I took a group of people here from work -  The service was outstanding the food was even better. I produced my "Yelp" coupon and it was honoured without question. The chips and salsa really get your attention, and some of the cocktails were excellent. They seated our group of 8 immediately, even while they had a large function going on outside. All who ate there were thrilled.
Bomb.com. Try the fajitas or enchiladas. It's enchanting. Check in for free dessert. Shout out to my girl Brent for hooking it up with to go chips n salsa.

I was pleasantly surprised by the great service and taste of the food.  I had an amazing waiter and the manager was even walking around asking how everyone's meals came out.  

I loved the chips and salsa.  There was a mix of different colored chips with different seasonings.  I ordered steak fajitas which came out hot, tender and delicious.  A lot of veggies and a lot of nice spices.  I ordered a slide of dulche De Leche, which was so good.  

My bill, with a 30% tip only came out to $20, which I thought was very reasonable.

The restaurant is located in a nice little plaza area with a cool looking courtyard, surrounded by an office building and a sweet looking Cathedral, a few blocks from Chace field.  I was glad I went here.

Long wait with super rude host.  Directed us to the bar and after being ignored for 20 minutes was told we would just have to wait until bartender would get to us.  Had to go up to bat individually to order our food and definitely knew we were putting him out.  Food ok.
Not bad place in downtown. Chips and salsa were good. Got two a la carte tacos...tempura fish and chicken. They were tasty. Happy Hour margs are a good price.

Great complimentary house made chips and salsa and the limit 2 margarita is the best I've had in awhile. Our server was very helpful and she did a great job given the busy night. The wait was a little long but the food and service was awesome and will definitely bring me back here!

We had a great experience at Canyon Cafe. Atmosphere was quiet with southwestern decorating. Food was great! A really cool mixed chips with flavoring to start, fajitas with great presentation and took advantage of the free dessert promo when you check in on yelp. The waitress was standout, she actually asked about our timeline! We had time to relax tonight and we weren't in a hurry but there are so many times when we are and they don't bother to ask. I would definitely recommend. The only reason it wasn't 5/5 was my fajitas were super wet, and rice was soaked in sauce.

We have eaten here at least 7 times in one week while visiting in Phoenix including lunch and dinner. Everything we tried was wonderful. We had salmon, tacos, fajitas,chimichanga  and salads. The deserts are especially good. Be sure to try their award winning Margaritas

Our prime reason for eating here was that it was directly across from the Sheraton and after a long flight, we were starving! We had a a decent sized group, around 10, and all of us were pleased with our meals!

I wish there had been a few more vegetarian options but was pleased with my selection of SPINACH & PORTABELLA MUSHROOM QUESADILLA. It had a perfect smoky taste. Not too cheesy or vegetably. A perfect balance in my opinion.

I would say the winners of our trips there were:

#1 The chips and salsa. The free chip basket seemed never ending and there were three different kinds of homemade  tortilla chips in each basket. The salsa had a nice chipotle kick and I filled up more than I intended to with the chips and salsa!

#2 Their infamous, "limit 2" margaritas. While I didn't have them myself, several people in my group did. They said they were strong and delicious and definitely did the job of getting the fiesta started!

If I'm ever in the downtown Phoenix area again, I'd stop by Canyon Cafe next time when they are having their Queso Bar. Sounds delicious.

Great TexMex/Southwestern food located in the Arizona center! Chips&Salsa, table side guac, margaritas, white chocolate pecan "tamales" and superb service made our last meal here in Phoenix a memorable one! 

SERVICE was excellent from everyone here. The hostess, server, and manager were great. In general, we felt everyone in AZ was friendly and this place was no exception. I had a few questions after seeing their menu and they were happy to answer them. My first two questions came after reading their sign at the front door:
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/6Wc5DPXGudcNi2XK7QfQtA?userid=QhYJx2jQdPuSq3fGe3aGcA#5bkxBk1xbLz1lfpCt1slkA

WHAT?!? LIMIT 2 MARGARITAS?! I never heard of this!! Our server explained that each margarita order is actually 2 glasses full, each glass has 2oz of alcohol so they limit you to 2 orders = 4 glasses = 8oz of tequila. I guess it's true, 1 tequila, 2 tequila, 3 tequila, floor. Recommend!
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/6Wc5DPXGudcNi2XK7QfQtA?userid=QhYJx2jQdPuSq3fGe3aGcA#9CoBAf2lHDm-VuDInPyyqA
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/6Wc5DPXGudcNi2XK7QfQtA?userid=QhYJx2jQdPuSq3fGe3aGcA#0EvNrLfD3apsqZt0tNaaBQ

CHIPS and SALSA! This is not your ordinary chips and salsa! Like everyone else says, these are great! The salsa is awesome by itself and the 4 different types of chips - wonton, sweet potato,  blue&white corn tortilla (some of which were dusted with some magic sweet/salty/spicy rub) just hit the spot. Awesomely recommend.

TABLESIDE GUACAMOLE! Holy guacamole! They explain all the ingredients that go into their guacamole to make sure everyone is ok with them and then proceed to make the freshest and best guac...take notes because this stuff is good! 
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/6Wc5DPXGudcNi2XK7QfQtA?userid=QhYJx2jQdPuSq3fGe3aGcA#iye-PBk09GNJJhpwsGFq5w

The dinner entrees were just okay. Nothing special going on there. But by this time you are wasted from the the two margaritas so it doesn't really matter. 

CHECK-IN on YELP, get free dessert! The white chocolate pecan tamales that arrived at our table were great, and this banana burrito was the free check-in offer!! 
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/6Wc5DPXGudcNi2XK7QfQtA?userid=QhYJx2jQdPuSq3fGe3aGcA#APw9-23ZffmGQj9u4lAv6A

I'm not gonna argue whether this place is authentic or not. I'm no expert. However, this place has stood the test of time, as we've visited this place multiple times over the past 10+yrs whenever we are in Phoenix because we like it.

My boyfriend and I came here for dinner for our anniversary after a baseball game and to our surprise, mostly everything was amazing! His adova rib eye was cooked just right and had succulent flavors to the dry last bite. My adova penne chicken pasta wasn't far behind! Not to mention the chocolate chip and pecan complimentary tamale was totally different than the traditional tamales we're accustomed to yet scrumptious! I would have gave this restaurant, formerly Sam's cafe, 5 stars but the guacamole was too lemony and our service was pretty slow at the beginning despite seeing tons of staff pass us on by, but once the manager took notice everything changed! Definitely coming back next time we're in Phoenix!
Chicken tacos were excellent. My wife loved the chicken avacdo salad. Visiting from Calif. We will eat here again on our next visit.
This was a great restaurant. Clean and friendly service. Wonderful margaritas, and the chips are yummy
Very nice lunch food. Carnitas are awesome and the white chocolate tamales are a nice finish.

This is a must visit place in Downtown Phoenix. The staff go out of their way to make each visit an experience. Tony, Richard, Kristen ,Amanda and the rest of the staff fo out of their way to make each guest feel special. The Chili Rubbed Sirloin is a must have and the margaritas are wonderfully refreshing. Anyone in the Downtown area for any reason should make it a point to visit this place. The fire pits in the evening are an amazing site as well. This place is 5 plus stars

My husband and I live downtown, and Sam's has become one of our favorite regular spots (bonus that the AMC theater is right there, too!). The chips are great- a variety of veggie, tortilla, and won-ton chips mixed in one basket. The tortilla soup, quesadillas, and especially the carnitas plate are all highly recommended. The Orange Beso margarita is so delicious and so big we always split one. The seafood pasta was acceptable, which is almost high praise in Phoenix where most of the seafood we've had is downright nasty. We've never had room for dessert, but the white chocolate/pecan corn husk is the perfect little bit of sweet at the end of the meal. Prices are fair and the outdoor seating is cool, but can be a little loud when they are crowded and the waterfalls are running in the courtyard. The service has always been good to excellent.

I have nothing bad but nothing spectacular to say about Canyon Cafe. 

My meal started with chips and salsa, but not normal chips Tortola chips, sopapilla chips and tiny sweet potato chips... all covered with Chile spice. Seemed like a good idea but the portions aren't right and the chili space conflicts with the salsa (which was good) but did not create a synergy.

I had two tacos and made it a meal with beans and rice. The Bison taco was slightly over spiced and being that the ground bison was very light in texture it took in too much other characters and was hard to differentiate from other beef. my chili Relleno  taco had mushrooms and an overabundance of tomato paste making it almost like lasagna.

Overall I have to say it's like they are trying too hard and creating these fusion recipes that miss the mark. Although things were palatable, the concepts employed were okay, and the service was good I have to give it a 3. I did see many good dishes I wish I had tried instead so I'm not completely averse to trying those items, but the tacos were certainly lackluster.

I was at Sam's for a work dinner with a group of six.  I couldn't believe that I had never been here before and I was excited to try a new place, so I could Yelp about it, of course!

My co-workers and I walked up on the wrong side of the cafe and came through the patio area.  Normally, I don't think this would have been a problem, however this night they had the majority of the patio roped off for a private function and we looked like we were trying to crash it.  Oops.  No harm done, they still let us into the restaurant.

While waiting for everyone in the group to arrive, the two girls at the hostess stand were watching us with little to no expression on their face.  I felt a little uncomfortable, they were not friendly and welcoming by any means, but they eventually sat us none the less and our service was great from there out.  We decided to sit inside as it was a little warm outside.

The server was nice and even joked around with us a bit.  I ordered the Orange Beso margarita.  It was good, since it was made with vodka instead of tequila, it wasn't quite a margarita for me, but hey, it tasted good.  Since they drop off the shaker so you can refill your own, it was the margarita that seemed to never end.  That made me happy!

Plenty of other people have mentioned the cool assortment of chips and the great salsa so I won't get into details.  I just leave it that I loved both!

For my meal I ordered the Black & Blue quesadilla.  It sure was yummy!  The steak was cooked and seasoned perfectly and as I've mentioned in many other reviews, the right amount of blue cheese is always a winner in my book.  This quesadilla was right on the money, not overpowering with the blue cheese.  I ended up taking half of it home.

As plenty of other reviewers have mentioned, the white chocolate tamale was great finish for the meal.  I'm not so big on desserts, but I usually crave a bite or two of sweet to finish lunch or dinner and this did the trick!

I can't wait to go back on the weekend to relax on the patio, drink some margaritas, and try more food.  I think next time I'd like to try some tacos . . .
Enjoyed a great lunch on the patio overlooking a gorgeous scenery. Chicken enchiladas are a must! Yum!
superbe terrasse au bord du jardin des fontaines.;trés romantique..;bonne cuisine un peu spicy

Sometimes you take a risk when you order the dish the waiter/waitress recommends.  This time the risk paid off!  She was 100% correct that I would love the Santa Fe Stuffed Chicken.

Talk about some good flavors.  First of all, if the dish includes goat cheese, it probably has already won me over.  You add creamy red pepper sauce (not spicy), a little pico de gallo, some asparagus and put it all on a bed of rice pilaf and I'm one happy camper!

Our waitress was nice.  Not the most attentive (considering we were the only ones in the dining room at first), but she was pleasant.  I wouldn't go back here based on just the service in other words.

The chips and salsa was a bit of a miss for me.  They seemed like they were fresh chips, but they were a strange mixture of sweet and salty that was a bit confusing.  Plus, we had a ton of broken chips so it was hard to enjoy the salsa.

Will I be back?  Probably.  I don't know if I'll want to try something else since I enjoyed the chicken so much.

Yummy Margarita, interesting fried calamari, and fabulous blackened fish tacos!

We decided we wanted Mexican Thursday night and found out within a walking distance of the Convention center you have about 3 choices for dinner.
The one closest was indicated as herendous, so we immediately skipped it. One of the "ambassadors" suggested this place and said the carnitas were fabulous.

We arrived right about 6pm and had no trouble getting seated outside. Our waitress was really friendly and happy.
I started with a house margarita (rocks, salt of course) and it came in a shaker that help pretty much the equivalent of 2!!  Hence the limit to 2 to a person! 
Very tasty! I didn't think it was very strong till i got up and started to walk around!

The chips and salsa were interesting. There were 2 different type of chips - some puffy with a bit of sweetness, some regular. Definitely tasty. And the salsa was good!

We started with corn encrusted calamari - very interesting and yummy! I did the blackened fish tacos, hubby went with the steak and blue cheese quesadilla.
The fish was amazing! Make sure you get extra salsa! The quesadilla was weird - not something we would get again.

Long time user of Yelp...first time reviewer and Sam's is the reason!

WOW...what a great restaurant and an even better experience.

First, the chips & salsa that showed up as we sat down - Almost impossible to describe how good this combination of sweet, spicy, flavorful and tangy this kickoff to dinner was.  You must go and you MUST have the chips and salsa...YUM!

Then, dinner.  And it was fast and delicioso!  I had the Black and Blue quesidilla and my partner had a pork dish and holy cramoly...amazing.  Not only was the service fabulous and fast, but the attention to detail was truly surprising AND, did I mention the food was fantastic!

Then we met up with Nicole - manager extraordinaire and a really nice person to socialize with during dinner.  She came over and asked how our dinner was going and then shared stories of her experiences with us and what's cool (and not so cool) about Phoenix.  Always great to hear it direct from a local . . . thanks Nicole, you made our evening really special.

And then finally, after all was said and done, our waitress Sally brought these little corn-husk wrapped fingerlings of vanilla infused white-chocolate with pecans encrusted throughout.  Seriously...just shoot me!

I'd give Sam's a 10 star rating, but then again, this is my first time reviewing a restaurant so, it's a pleasure to start off my Yelp career with such a great and wonderful place.  PLUS, there's a Canyon Cafe' restaurant (parent company of Sam's) about 10 minutes from my house in St. Louis so as soon as I get back home, I'd headed there for more fun and food.

Thanks Sam's...WOW!

Went here per a friends margarita suggestion. I had the Rico Rita which was a piña colada-ish flavored margarita. Very tasty while a little on the light side. For $10 you got about 2 glasses worth as they bring out the shaker, which was nice. I didn't order an entree but I did attack the chips which were awesommmme! The basket was a mix of a few different types, including sweet potato, with a southwestern spice sprinkled on. Yum yum yum! I would go back for the chips and a heavier handed margarita!

Amazing food, I couldn't stop eating the chips and salsa. It was my first time here and I want to come back soon. KEITH provided awesome customer service. I felt welcomed and well taken care of, his recommendations were great. Food was amazing!!! I know I'm coming back!!! Thanks Keith and who ever cooked my food

The other day my coworkers and I decided to go to Canyon Cafe.  Also this restaurant used to be called Sam's Cafe.    They changed names back in February.  

So, we got our drinks and we order the Queso dip to start our meal off and then we ordered our food.   Then the Queso dip came out.  It was really good, but it was also a little runny.  

Now for our food, when they were handing us the food.  The lady was passing the fajitas across me to my coworker and the juice from the fajitas spilled all over me and my meal.  Luckily I had my napkin in my lap, but it still got on my jeans.  You would think that a manager would come over and apologize for what happen or at least comp my food.  Instead they told me that they would pay for my dry cleaning bill, if I wanted to get my jeans dry cleaned.    

Other than the spill the meal was great. I ordered the basin Meatloaf. I totally recommend the meatloaf.  It was one the best meatloaf I have had in a long time.  Last but not least our waiter was really nice and did a great job taking care of us.

This is the first sit down restaurant I ate at here in Phoenix and I have to say it is just awesome. The service was great, the food was super delicious (I had the street tacos w/ rice and beans), the salsa is probably one of the best I've ever eaten. Great ambiance. Love that you can eat outdoors or indoors. Will definitely be coming back here the next time I'm in Phoenix! :)

The margaritas here are good.  All of them.  We stopped in during our Cinco de Mayo, Tour de Margarita, and were not disappointed.  Unfortunately we did not eat during this visit, much to the detriment of our sobriety, but I'm sure there will be a next time.

Margaritas and chips are awesome!   Guacamole is to die for 
I also got 2 tacos.  They were good but hard to eat after stuffing myself with chips guacamole and salsa. 

I would recommend 

Dessert coming yet..,,


Down here for the  super bowl
Came on Cinco de Mayo.....friendly hostess, nice server, excellent margaritas and yummy food!!
Great for a quick bite to eat. Very tasty and very easy on the wallet! Service was fantastic as well.

One of the best meals I've had in Phoenix Awesome location. Chicken and Shrimp tacos were amazing. The Margarita coleslaw was a nice fresh take on the classic coleslaw. I will definitely come back. The White chocolate almond tamales were awesome.

I've only been here for happy hour and I thoroughly enjoyed it. Margaritas for $3 and food items for $3, $4, or $5. I had two margaritas and a chicken quesadilla and spent only $10. Can't really complain about that. The bartenders are cute and friendly and they have MLB Network. What more does a girl need?

Everything about this place was fantastic.  I had the chicken quesadilla and I swear it was the best quesadilla I have ever had.  I went with some colleagues for lunch, while on a training break.  We all had different entrees and all loved our food.  When I checked in on Yelp, I was pleasantly surprised with a free desert.  I got the cheesecake and fell in love.  Highly recommended.

I would moreso give this a 2.5 rather than 3 but it was pretty good! The salsa they bring out with chips is very smoky and rich/tomatoey. Pretty interesting combo with the chips that have some sort of sweet spice dusted on them. I got the pork chili relleno. Beautiful presentation and very filling, but the flavors were a little bland. The rice very much so. I also ordered a tres leches cake which was honestly disappointing. The patio setting is beautiful so if the weather isn't sweltering hot, definitely sit outside!

This restaurant closes their doors at 10pm SHARP!! My mom and I arrived at the restaurant at 10pm. The hostess planned to close the restaurant. Thank you Manager of the restaurant for letting us stay!!

We basically had 5 minutes to look at the menu. Our waitress wanted us out ASAP. I didn't look at the menu carefully so I just picked something out of the Specialty section. 

Anyway, the chips and salsa were awesome!!! Our basket of chips had three varieties: corn tortilla, blue corn tortilla, and a sweet and spicy chip. I really liked the sweet and spicy chip since it tasted like a slightly spicy churro. Yum!  The salsa had a black bean flavor and chunks of tomatoes. Also yummy.

The food came out so quickly!! It took like 10 minutes for the food to come out. Haha.

I had the Santa Fe Stuffed Chicken Breast. mMmMM.. the stuffing was so good!! I loved the herb-goat cheese mixed with the red pepper cream sauce and the cilantro pesto. The chicken was very moist! The asparagus wasn't too good, as it was chewy. However, the southwest rice pilaf was so creamy and had a smoky flavor. I also loved the extra touch of the tortilla chips on top of the dish. Lovely presentation!

My mom had the Chicken Penne Pasta with the cilantro pesto. The chicken was moist, and the pesto had a deep cilantro flavor. If you hate cilantro, stay away from this dish!! There was a tad bit too much olive oil, but the strong cilantro flavor was awesome!

It was a pleasant surprise to receive a frozen white chocolate tamale. YUMMY! I only eat white chocolate so I was so excited to eat this. Loved the nuts and the sweetness. 

Again, our waitress was not very nice to us. So I'm taking off a point for the service.

We were out the door by 10:40pm.
AMAZEBALLS! Great drinks, delicious food and excellent service.  Beautiful views, patio comfortable. Will come back often...bottomless chips and salsa like no other. Exceeded my expectations by far.

I went with three others on a Saturday afternoon. We were not greeting with a warm welcome. The hostess was very rude to me and the others in my party. When she seated us she did not tell us when our server would be around and she didn't check the cleanliness of the table. There was fresh bird poop in multiple places on our outside table. We moved OURSELVES  inside and the hostess never came to check what the problem was or why we moved.The restaurant was pretty much empty so she should've been able to do that.  All but two plates at our table were dirty. We waited about 15 minutes before we actually saw our server. We ordered drinks and food at the same time. We waited another 10 minutes for those. We waited 20-30 minutes for our food and when we needed any kind of wait staff there was no one around. On top of that they don't validate parking and if they do they didn't offer that. When we finally got our food our meters for our car had ran out and we had to go out to refill them. The food tasted good but I've had better and for the amount of food you get I think this place is overpriced. I definitely will think twice before dining here again.
Good food, and excellent service. I recommend asking to be waited on by Johnny.

Although the house margaritas and table made guacamole were outstanding the rest of our meal was not worthy of 2 stars. I tried the chicken enchiladas and after unwrapping the rubbery flour tortilla I found only a few small cubes of chicken the size of sugar cubes. The rice was smothered in so many flavors that it did not appeal so left behind most of my dinner. Tilapia tacos were thin pieces of tasteless blackened fish and one of the two tacos had a piece as this as the taco shell itself. Would not recommend.

I am so expressed by the courtesy of the manager of this restaurant when my Agency had a fund raiser at the Arizona Cafe.  He invited our team to have lunch, gratis, after all the work we had done.  

The service was excellent and the food very good.  I had the carnitas which were a little spicy for my liking but there was plenty of it and take home provided a lunch the next day.  I have GERD so maybe if I had not just had a stressful week, they would have agreed more with me.  The second lunch I had a few days later, a salad was even better, very fresh with a dressing that was not overpowering as they can be.  Once again, excellent service.

The only thing I regret was the weather was on the cold side.  It looked like the patio would have been a beautiful setting for a nice lunch.

I have no issues with suggesting you try the Canyon Cafe.
Such a great time and the food was delicious. Topeaka was super awesome and such a sweetheart!!!!!!

I've been to Sam's several times and have never been disappointed. My most recent visit was last night. We skipped the appetizer only because we had tickets to a show but not to worry because the complementary chips and salsa are outstanding! You don't even need the salsa as the chips are seasoned, fresh and uniquely delicious. Husband had the chicken quesadilla and inhaled it before I could try it but he loved it. I was torn between the Stuffed Chicken and the Spinach and Portobello quesadilla. I had (and loved) the chicken dish my last visit so I went with the spinach and mushroom quesadilla which was wonderfully simple and delicious with a fresh and tasty salad on the side. We didn't have time for dessert but again, not to worry as the complementary white chocolate nibble they serve at the end of the meal hits the spot. Next time we come to Sam's we will hopefully have more time for appetizer and dessert. I also need to commend the attentive wait staff and pleasant atmosphere especially when the weather allows you to sit outside

The food was good, but I can't say as much for the service. Our server forgot to put in the order for one member of our party and of course didn't notice until the rest of the order arrived. The manager offered a half assed apology (they couldn't have felt too bad about it, they didn't offer any kind of discount). This was pretty much the turning point of the evening; our server seemed to avoid our table for the rest of the evening. We even had a hard time getting our check so we could leave. Undecided if we will try them again.

I remember the first time we had a White Chocolate wrapped tamale.  It was here, about ten years ago. 

Canyon Cafe is a fun, southwest culinary stop - that your taste buds will thank me for later. Whenever, we're near the AZ Center, we try to make a stop here (boy, do we still miss their Biltmore location).  So in Yelp lingo... yes, we are a Fan. 

Mind you, don't get me wrong, they're not perfect - which is why this isn't a Five Star review.  But Canyon Cafe has so many things going for it, it's an easy Four Stars.  A no brainer.
