First, let me start with the chips and salsa. Their pita chips are made in three different styles, Chinese Puff Wonton, Sweet Potato and a Sweet & Spicy combo (photo).  

I could write a few hundred words on each.  Their complex flavors, the spices used and yet, the star here is their smokey chipotle móle Salsa. Wow, what an incredible layer of flavors. It's chocolate base comes through ever so gently, with a hint of heat that doesn't overwhelm. Nice. 

Second, what to drink. Every Mexican inspired restaurant has a bunch of margaritas on their menu. And somewhere in that predictable and pedantic, sirupy mess is some tequila. Yawn. Boring. 

Canyon Cafe's drinks are a must. Names like Grand Canyon, (which is a Prickly Pear Catcus nectar type), Blue Moon (made from Blue Curaçao), and Mango Rita are all delicious. Really outstanding. But our favorite, is their Raspberry Chambord flavored Coyote mix. It's a must. 

Okay, what's for dinner?  Everything here is good and their fish tacos are the best.  But tonight, we went with the "Naked" Chile Relleno and the Panchos Enchiladas roasted chicken, both were $13. 

Their charred poblano pepper Chili Relleno, reminds me of some of the best we've had in Santa Fe (photo). It's a fajita marinated steak, with adovo mushrooms, beans, light melted cheese, and a level 4/10 heat index ranchero sauce, served on a bed of rice. The meat is tender and melts in your mouth. The rice itself is outstanding.  I even took a photo of it, so you could see how complex and interesting it is. 

The Enchiladas comes with chucks of chicken, Jack cheese and a three pepper cream sauce (photo). It's fresh tomato salsa is nothing like the móle serviced with the chips, it's light and tasty. It also comes with its own southwest rice and greens. 

For dessert, we used our free Yelp Coupon and went with the flourless chocolate cake. It was thick, rich and chewy. Nice!

Our server Kristen presented us with our white chocolate wrapped tamale (no mas!), and the bill which came to $58.74, including taxes but before gratuities. Kristen was always nearby and very friendly & pleasant; so ask to sit in her section. 

Enjoy,

I visited over the lunch our.  My friends had a taco salad that was not very good.  My food on the other hand was excellent (the spinach portabella quesadilla). So two bad meals and one good, why the 5 stars, right?  None of us said a word about the meal issues but someone came up and asked if we weren't happy and they told them the beef was a little tough and not good.  Almost immediately the manager shows up apologizing and explained there had been done kind of different meat than usual- they had noticed that they had not fished the meat and so they I wired.  They told us they would discontinue use of that meat vendor and they took it off our bill then brig ought complementary desserts that were also amazing.  My food from start to finish was excellent and the service recovery was impressive.  We will definitely be back!

Good food overall.  The guacamole was excellent!  The group enjoyed their entrees overall.  I had the seared tuna which was very good. Margaritas were potent...which is good .  Desserts were also enjoyable - tres leche cake was moist and tastie.  Atmosphere was ok.  Cost per person was about $40 person with a drink or so.

Tasteless. Nasty. 
A definite go when you have no desire to eat good tasty food, and no desire to impress out of town visitors. Calamari tasted like rubber, prickly pear margherita was iced down to the fullest. My stomach hurts. But the staff was nice.

I hosted a group lunch for 35 people on the patio at Sam's a week or so ago.  They were so prepared and had our buffet ready to go when our group arrived.  The chips and salsa are amazing...a meal all into themselves.  The chicken enchiladas were so tasty.  The patio is the place to sit at Sam's to overlook the beautiful gardens at the Arizona Center - such a great view!

I came here for dinner with a big group of people, probably over 30 people, and I have to say I was very impressed with the hospitality and great service from this restaurant. 

First off, my group made reservations at the wrong restaurant and we were staying at the Hyatt about 5 min away and we had no idea where a group as large as us could eat last minute. However, our concierge directed us to Canyon Cafe and upon calling, they were very willing to accommodate for our party. Luckily, it was a weekday evening and there were not too many people there. When we arrived we were welcomed by a very beautiful patio area with palm trees, string lights, and a pond, perfect for a group picture. The restaurant was charming too with a Tex-Mex influence. I also must compliment on their hospitality when one of our group members changed from eating outside to inside last minute and the restaurant had to accommodate very quickly. 

I tried their Orange Besos alcoholic beverage and it was delicious. The price seemed like a lot at first but you get enough for two servings so you can easily share with a friend, or be selfish like me and down it all. They serve salsa and chips as you are waiting, but that was honestly the best chips and salsa I've ever had. The chips had really great seasoning and the salsa was the perfect spice. I also ordered chicken quesadilla for my meal, and I strongly encourage you to share unless you're a fatty like me! It was really good too, they have chipotle sauce on it that tasted great, along with guacamole on the side. I enjoyed it for breakfast the next morning as well.

I have no complaints against the restaurant considering we threw a lot on them last minute. Getting our checks took a while, but what can you do when you have a group this large. All in all, I enjoyed this restaurant and give huge props for their service.

I've been here twice now.  My first visit was great.  The service was perfect.  I was pleasantly surprised by the chips and salsa and the special of the day was excellent.  It was a very interesting mix of Italian and southwest.  

My second visit didn't go quite as well.  My group was sat at the very back of the restaurant and the servers visits where few and far between.

Perhaps I should stop wearing my "bearded for her pleasure" shirt when I eat out...

Coming from Portland, OR, Phoenix is like going into the twilight zone. I actually asked the hostess where all the people are. Downtown Portland is filled with people all the time. I realize that the 100+ degree weather is a downer, but I've seen maybe 100 people in my whole day. Most of them working.

So needless to say, the Cactus Café was not busy. In the over an hour I was there no more than 10 people came through the door. The atmosphere was great. The chips and salsa was very good, the chips were seasoned with chili and were of different varieties which is different from the chips I expect at a normal place.

I was recommended the Chicken Tamales which were delicious. They were served with a normal salad, and I think they could be more creative for a side dish than just a plain romaine lettuce salad. By checking in on Yelp I received a free dessert which was a great bonus. The server recommended the Banana Burrito, which I will recommend to everyone. Who doesn't love deep fried tortilla filled with bananas served with ice cream covered in chocolate and caramel. It was delicious. The price was bearable for a downtown atmosphere, basically what I expected, but the desert as a bonus really made it worth it.

Came here twice for dinner while staying at a hotel across the street for a conference. Staff was very friendly. Food was awesome. The first night I had the Carnitas Platter...second night I tried Pancho's Enchiladas. The chips and salsa were yummy! Nicely seasoned, and once in awhile you'll find some sweet potato chips mixed in. The white chocolate tamale they give you at the end of your meal was a perfect ending.

I went to Sam's cafe with a group of 8-10 and they had no problem accommodating us, even though the restaurant was packed.  The service was great and the food was amazing!  The complimentary chips and salsa were addictive.  The variety of chips was incredible, sweet potato, multicolored corn chips, and some other unidentifiable but delicious vegetable based chips.  Amazing.

I had a stuffed chicken dish and my date had the carnitas plate.  I tried them both and they were really delicious, but the carnitas was definitely the better of the two.  It was moist and tender, but with delicious crispy caramelized edges. 

I didn't hear a single complaint about the food and drink from anyone at the table!  The only complaints I could possibly voice are about the atmosphere.  It was very crowded on a Friday after work and so it was pretty loud.  The sun beating through the floor to ceiling window was a little much, I was blinded for the first third of our meal and it was a little warm.  Once the sun went down, it was pretty great though.  I would go back!

Canyon Cafe has the potential to be an idyllic restaurant, but falls short on nearly all aspects one desires in a dining experience. I want this place to succeed, I really do, but based upon a couple of my experiences here it seems they themselves do not want to succeed.

Canyon Cafe has a really nice location in downtown Phoenix at the Arizona Center. One of its main selling points is the huge shaded patio overlooking the Arizona Center courtyard with tall palm trees and soothing waterfalls. They have some of the best margaritas I've ever tasted. The food is mediocre.

My first three times here last winter were great. Canyon Cafe was one of my first restaurant experiences in Phoenix, as I had just accepted my first big boy job and had relocated from Pennsylvania. I was in love with the new climate and the countless varieties of margaritas. The food was so-so, but the atmosphere and service received were wonderful. My server was the older lady with shorter gray hair--perfect! 

My fourth time was on a Friday night, and we arrived to a surprisingly empty restaurant around 8:30 for dinner. The chile-rubbed sirloin left a lot to be desired, but the Orange Beso margaritas were its saving grace. I really love these margaritas, and I highly recommend this place for margaritas, and margaritas only, but only if you want to stop drinking them by 10pm on a Friday night. I didn't know they closed at 10pm on a Friday night until the server presented me the check at 10pm saying that they close at 10pm on Friday nights. Seriously? I'm not one to consciously stay past closing time, but giving one of your few remaining repeat customers the proverbial 'foot in the ass' is probably a big reason as to why you have no one in your restaurant on a Friday night. That, and you don't have a HH to lure customers in earlier in the evening. Get with the program.

In the spirit of redemption, I came here solo for a late lunch yesterday. The place was nearly empty, but that's to be expected at 4pm on a weekday. I picked a nice patio table overlooking the courtyard on an absolutely beautiful 80 degree day. I sipped on my Blue Moon margarita, wayfarers on, giving thanks I wasn't in the torrent of shit that was unloading on the east coast. I ordered the Salmon Caesar Salad and went back to sipping and basking. Five minutes later my waitress returns asking me what I ordered. Sip.

This particular Caesar salad has apple and pear slices in it, which sounded deliciously refreshing. I was let down when the bowl arrived and the pieces were about the width of a toothpick. The salad and dressing were great, but the salmon tasted too fishy, leading me to believe it was old. 

I'm about halfway finished with my margarita when my server drops the check, not even asking me if i'd like another margarita. There are literally three tables in the entire restaurant and I feel like I'm being rushed out again. I don't touch the check, but proceed to sip, people watch, and check my phone to see how the market did. Ten minutes later she opens the check presenter that's on my table,

"Oh, you're not finished?"
    No.
"Just enjoying the weather?"
    ..........

I think I'm finished now. I'm finished with this restaurant. This place is a headache. Also check out their website. It looks like something I could have created using Visual Basic in high school. This place reeks of complacency. 2 stars only because of the margaritas.

Very busy Saturday night arrived near the end of happy hour.  Was a 45 min wait but we were able to sit in the bar.  Calamari  was delicious.  I had the ahi salad..yummy.  Got the free dessert with yelp coupon.  Oh, the 'Rita's to die for!

In town for a conference at the convention center and stumbled upon this place across the street for lunch one day - what a happy surprise!  Loved the house-made chips they bring as soon as you're seated - not just your average tortilla chips but also wontons and sweet potato chips, and all with a nice sized bowl of a really flavorful smoky chipotle-style salsa - delish!  It's a good thing the kitchen is quick because my Cobb salad that came out a short time later was gigantic.  I would probably say this is one of the top Cobbs I have ever had - every item on it tasted fresh and crisp and good quality, and there were a lot of unique items included - oh so much more than your average Cobb.
I planned all week to go back at night for dinner and margaritas but never did make it - boo!
Excellent food! It was a convenient walk from our hotel. The restaurant atmosphere was great. Everything was reasonably priced and the service was good.

Best $8 lunch, the chips and salsa was a great start, a mix of chips with a thick, flavorful salsa. The the two large chicken enchiladas with salad on the side was plenty. Service and outside dining was great.
It's the best place to come to eat with your friend and family I would recommend this place to any one who wants to come chill and have a good time food

This is a great place for fantastic and authentic southwestern food. The chips were homemade and had a nice little kick to them as well as the salsa. And the flautas were really tasty and nicely presented. The waitress was very friendly. You really can't beat sitting on the patio on a clear evening.  The prices were totally reasonable too.

For me, this place is very satisfactory. It's not super great, but it gets the job done. Also, I liked the chips and salsa that they served starting off. It was a nice mix of torilla chips and sweet potato chips. The service overall was really friendly and prompt and I didn't have a whole lot of complaints on that end.

My one complaint? The portions served. I got a chimichanga that looks like a fried burrito from chipotle with a side salad. It was a pretty good chimichanga, but i didn't feel that great after eating the body weight of a newborn with a side salad to boot. As you can tell, I'm not big on leaving anything on my plate. 

Lastly, the cherry on the frosting for me was the white chocolate pecan dessert thing they give you at the end. It's their version of the chocolate mints that they give you with the bill. Come here to eat, don't come here for fine dining.
A hidden place with good food and terrific service. Limited beers but choices at good. The bison meat loaf was very well presented and a great choice.

Came here upon my cousins recommendation. Glad we did. We sat outside on the patio because it was unbearably cold inside. The chips and salsa were different than ive ever had: crispy, good spice with a hint of sweetness. A raspberry margarita hit the spot. I ordered a chicken salad, lots of breast meat chicken, and a delicious salad dressing. Great service, just watch out for the birds they are ready to EAT too!! When in town i'd come back here.

Went for dinner with my wife while I was in town for a conference. We ate here because it looked nice and was located close to our hotel. We were seated and waited quite a while for a server. Our server did not introduce herself, and it was obvious she didn't know the menu well. It eventually became apparent she was training, but no one ever told us this before we asked her. 
We ordered a pitcher of Sangria, which we had to remind her what we ordered and it took an excessive amount of time to arrive. 
We had ordered guacamole as well, and had to ask about it after not receiving it, her response was "oh yeah." 
I didn't see her waiting on any other tables, so I'm not sure what was so difficult.
The food was okay, not spectacular. 

I might come back, but better supervision of a training server would be nice.

Nicely located in the Arizona Center in an open air mall downtown which is beautiful with lush landscaping. Some pricey entrees but there is lots of price ranges and options to pick from. They had terrific 3 flavor chips and a wonderful smoky chipole type of salsa to start. All of our food was fantastic and flavorful. Our waitress "Topeka" was excellent, and she was a one person show making the homemade table side guacomole, along with being a top notch wait staff person too. Beautiful magarita's and I had a killer mojito which was best I have had for years. We split the table side steak fajitas with all the extras! We will would go there again anytime, Next time for happy hour too 4-7pm and be happy!

Wow! So I work at a prison and I've had inmate meals occasionally, so there is a certain standard of food and taste that I have developed. It's really not that hard to please me with food, especially after having prison food but Sam's cafe really questioned whether or not I was an inmate that night. 

I ordered one of their specials, which was the pork enchiladas. When I got the tray, I initially thought they had mistaken the dish for a three rolled tacos, with mole-like sauce? First I had to decipher if it was fried, which was later confirmed. Then the sauce on top was definitely something that you cannot label. It had a sweet, mole, yet bitter taste, with sour cream that was light and fluffy and made it look like whip cream. I know . . . strange you say? The pork was dried out and even the two of us could not finish this one meal that was split. The beans tasted hallow, if that's even possible and the rice was extra dry. 

I am sorry to give this such a harsh review, but it's the truth and sometimes the truth hurts. I have to say they do have great margaritas and the best part was the complimentary white chocolate, pecan thing they gave at the end. Sorry Sam's but this will be my first and last time.

This place is great! Definitely deserves more than the 3.5 stars it has on here!

The chips and salsa are the best I've ever had. I got steak fajitas that were excellent. My friend really enjoyed her meal as well (can't quite remember what it was). Very fair prices, almost cheap for how good it is and the ambiance is quite nice. Definitely worth a visit, I'll probably eat here every time I visit Phoenix!

I like the food at Sam's and I like the happy hour. I don't know if they've changed management or service since they changed their name to Canyon Cafe but the service here frustrated me so badly I had to give it 2 stars for "I've experienced better."  The wait for food is rather long most times of the day, which, at lunch time especially, can suffice as a reason NOT to go here. You definitely won't make it back to work within an hour.  

But here's the main reason I started boycotting Sam's. I went here with a friend who is allergic to cilantro once. She tried ordering 4 different things that presumably wouldn't have cilantro on them and each time she selected something the waiter just said "That has cilantro too." How about helping to identify some items WITHOUT cilantro, Mr. Waiter?! When she had finally just decided NOT to eat at all, I asked the waiter if he could go ask the cook if he could make anything without cilantro so my friend could eat.  Rather than doing that, he said, "well, I know all the ingredients in everything so that won't help." Nice. Finally I asked the waiter if the chef could make a quesadilla (tortillas & cheese!!!!!!) without cilantro and he STILL said no.  Do you know why? Because it's served with pico de gallo on top. HELLO?!?! just leave it off....idiot. It was really a terrible experience. Usually restaurants at least ATTEMPT to accommodate food allergies. NOT this one. 

THEN, to cap it all off, I asked for parking validation for the garage when we were ready to go. All restaurants at the Arizona Center give validation for parking because why would you pay an additional $5-$10 just to eat at so-so restaurants?  The hostess responded with a simple, "Sorry - we're out". I had no patience left after the no-cilantro fiasco so I inquired further and finally a manager came out and said, "Oh - no parking? - I'll go get more validations from our sister restaurant around the corner." He was back in 1 minute. How difficult was that? The lack of problem-solving skills among the staff here really astounded me, and for this reason, despite the fact that this place is super convenient to my job and home, I haven't been back since.

Yummmmy. For such a humble name, this place really exceeds expectations.  

Nice ambiance, and good food.  They really impressed me right off the bat with their chips and salsa.  The chips were assortment that were quite good and far from the ordinary corn tortillas you'd expect at any old Mex/Tex-Mex restaurant.   I had  the tortilla soup and the spinach & mushroom quesadilla which were quite good too.  But, I must say, the best part was the white chocolate tamales that they serve at the end of the meal... a most pleasant surprise and a wonderful end to a nice meal :)

I agree with some of the reviews, this place has the potential to be a go-to Downtown Phoenix restaurant, but falls short on so many levels. The only part of my meal that I can say was good was the chips and salsa - that is the only thing they have down. The staff was okay.  But there are so many other restaurants near here that it is going to hard to come back.

They have a great outdoor patio and location so they have the ability to thrive. My coworkers and I all felt the same way, our main entrees were awful.  All I had was a salad and soup, and I'm not sure how that can be messed up but it was.  There was not enough flavor and overall zest.

Canyon was kind supplying us with white peppermint chocolate tamales for dessert, which were quite tasty. But that is not going to be enough to win back the meal.

I returned here fr a birthday lunch with a co-worker.

I was a bit sad to see the Tuna sandwiches was removed from the menu leaving me with the $13 tuna plate option. It comes with two decently sized Cajun pieces of tuna, on a bed of rice and veggies. I asked for rare and it came medium well however.

There is a new small bites menu for budget conscious lunch crowd.

The validation is no longer of much use, it is just $1 off now.

As allays the chips are great.

Let me start off by saying I usually don't complain about service but this has happened way too many times.  This establishment I frequent once a month at least and service is typically good.  However, tonight, Valentine's Day, I decided to meet up with a relative.  I go to the restroom come out to my table, the waiter never asked me for my meal order, barely asked for my drink order.  I was completely unaware that he had already taken my cousins order until he brings out his meal, then he looked at me and said "oh would you like something" REALLY!  At this point, I was fuming inside, first of all, why didn't you ask for my order at the same time you took my cousins order this is your job and why at this point would I place an order, generally, most people go to restaurants to eat together and not separate, go figure.  I thought it was completely rude and inconsiderate of the waiter and he seemed oblivious to the fact and there is absolutely no excuse.  I must say this is not the first time this has happened.
Accommodating to gluten free needs. Fish tacos, chips, & salsa were great. Service excellent.  Also liked the complimentary chocolate tamale dessert.

We loved it here! The bartender, Kirsten, was amazing and happy hour pricing is great! Margaritas and tacos were done well and service was really quick and efficient We'll be coming back anytime we're in pheonix!

If you like Lawry's chili powder and cumin, you will love this place because they are on EVERYTHING. Chips? Check. Salsa? Check. Rice? Check. Chicken? Check. The tableside guacamole and margarita were the highlight, though the guac needed salt (easy fix). Service was good. In my opinion, the food is reminiscent of what you buy in a plastic box at an airport. Won't be back.

I stopped in with my wife last night, as we are both new to the city and were celebrating our anniversary. The food was great. However, the staff went out of their way to go above and beyond my expectations. They were friendly and prompt and the manager made us feel important as patrons.

Below average Mexican food. Salsa is non traditional.  Chips were seasoned which was weird.  Drinks were week, and service at the bar was terrible.  Go somewhere else.  Seriously, not worth your time.
Service was great!! Fajitas were just okay. I would order something different next time

In town for a conference.  Wandered over to this mall full of chain restaurants and found Sam's to be a gem.

Food was fresh, large quantities. Great flavors.  I had a vegetable taco.  Not the same old bell peppers, mushrooms, and onions.  This had asparagus, spinach, zuch.  

Waitress provided great service.  Gave us free guacamole. Outdoor seating is lovely, though lots of skanky pigeons and flies.

My first and only visit so far to Sam's Cafe was quite nice. The house margarita is a bit pricey, but they offer some good happy deals so be sure to get in on those. I had the Black and Blue quesadilla and it was delicious. Our server was bit quirky but friendly and attentive. The atmosphere on the patio is wonderful. With the fountains nearby and plenty of opportunity for people watching, you can easily relax and enjoy your visit.
I won't say Sam's blew my mind, but I would definitely visit again. Especially for hour happy.

I really enjoyed this place. I had some great grilled tuna with rice and veggies. It was cooked perfectly and the seasonings didn't overwhelm the tuna. Everyone else at the table got more traditional mexican dishes...tacos, fajitas etc. and they really seemed to enjoy them! I also had an AMAZING margarita. It was a specialty one with citrus flavors, I don't even like tequila but it was delicious. The outdoor seating area is beautiful. We ate surrounded by trees covered in twinkle lights, so pretty.
Service was great! Ambiance and location are good. I had the tortilla soup, which was very good! Not impressed with the steak quesadilla. The meat was a little chewy and tough.

Average, the cheese dip was good. I got the Black and Blue quesdillas, which were great! But the side of slaw was not great, I wish it would have come with beans and rice. Overall it is not a bad place, but not the place to go out of your way for.

Canyon Cafe is located in Downtown Phoenix in the Arizona Center. They serve Tex-Mex- sort of Spanish inspired food. They offer a really nice patio, complimentary assortment of interesting chips and salsa and complimentary white chocolate pecan tamales with the check.


I had the Blacken Salmon Caesar. The salmon was ok on a bed of warm wilted greens and garnished with unripe tomatoes. The dressing lacked flavors of anchovy, Worcestershire and black pepper maybe they were busy and the kitchen ran out of those things....? The dressing tasted like mayonnaise thinned down with lots of water and lemon juice. 

My husband had the Chile Relleno stuffed with fajita steak. I tasted a small piece of steak and it was tender and flavorful. I didn't try the ranchero sauce but my husband said it tasted just like the salsa and over powered the fajita steak. (the salsa was very strong with lime)  My husband insisted that I try the Paella Rice. It tasted like boxed seasoned rice infused with enough smoke to season all of Arizona and maybe a neighboring state. I'd say someone slipped with the smoke flavoring.

On the way out we saw table tents on the specials that nobody told us about.

The positives were the atmosphere of the patio, The interesting and massive assortment of chips (some vegetable chips, tortillas that were savory, sweet, plain and different textures and colors) the complimentary white chocolate, pecan tamale.

I'm splitting this right down the middle with 3 stars.  Things I really enjoyed...the patio, location and chips to start were great.  Things we didn't love..again, the patio was insanely loud, and the food was just ok.  For southwest food it hit the mark but wasn't my favorite overall.  And my street tacos were just ok, the tortillas being soggy, almost like they weren't cooked all the way.

I had the carnitas and enchiladas.  the carnitas were fine but no better than what you can get at trader joes and the pancho's enchiladas were just plain bad.  they had no flavor, and the tortillas were hard.  the chips were unique, seasoned and sweet potato, but the salsa was no better or worse than a dozen other Mexican places I've been to.  I'm from California so maybe I'm a little spoiled when it comes to good Mexican, but regardless this place fell way short.  oh!  and I asked for no onions and the plate was covered in them!  poor form.

Great service,  interesting food.  
I ate at the bar and looked it so much I got some friends and went back the next day for more.  The tacos are delicious and you can pick a couple different filings.  

The best thing on the menu is the table side guac.  The dip is delicious,  but the chips are incredible.  I ate an entire basket without realizing it.  

4 stars because it was solid quality, nothing wrong but nothing mind blowing,  so I rarely give 5.

Was just ok... Food wise

I had higher expectations afterall this is az.  Land of southwest cuisine.  Sorry guys it tasted like eating at chilis at an off night...Ive had better mexican food at a hole in the wall in long beach, la, tucson. 

Came with a large group for a convention (15 of us).
-slow service and the restaurant was not packed it was a tue night 730 pm. Maybe they understaff during the week? We still tipped our gal nicely...
-table side guac saved it for me fresh, not too much heat or salt

Apps:
(Calamari too much breading and way too salty. Chicken quesadilla tons of make your tummy hurt cheese)

-had the steak fajitas... Beef was not good quality. Under seasons and veggies over cooked. My rice/beans looked dry and sad like they were waiting under a heat lamp for 30 min.

-my colleague had the shrimp fajitas looked like old defrosted baby shrimp.. Just a sad lookin plate (not worth any pix)

Id come back for drinks and apps but not dinner.
The patio at night is pretty
Amazing bartender, she treated us so nice. Great happy hour & they also have a nacho cheese bar when you seat inside at the bar. Definitely coming back again.

It's a day like any other, or so you think. 
During your daily exercise session, a short walk to the mailbox, everything is about to change.
You're a goner now.
It's a letter from the class reunion committee with your wife's hyphenated maiden name on it, and this can only mean one thing.
Saying goodbye to carbs for the next 3 months as she starts serving up swill with hefty amounts of god forsaken vegetables and no carbs. 
Yes, she'll try any diet to lose weight, and on her way down, into this veggie-eating, omni-farting hell, take you with her in the process. 

It's ok, don't panic.
You're a yuppie remember? You live downtown in one of those overpriced lofts, within walking distance from the Arizona Center. 

Here's my recommendation.

Walk to Sam's. It's a few more steps than the mailbox, but at least you won't find any unwanted surprises. 
Carb loading? You bet. 
Order the Desert Fire Pasta, Pancho's Carnitas, or the Chicken Quesadilla. 
All noteworthy, especially if you're trying to negate the affects of your wife's cabbage-reunion soup. 
Sam's delights. Try it.

being in phoenix, i was hoping for some killer mexican food. canyon cafe was ok. came here for dinner, but wasn't impressed by anything on the menu. ordered the steak fajitas and it was unexpectedly sweet. raspberry margarita was good though!
The only reason why I am giving this a 3, is because the Bison Burger was great! Other then that, coming from So.Cali, this Mexican style of food does not compare. But I would give it a try again.

This place was recommended by the Hyatt during my stay. The service was awesome and the food was even better!! We had a big party and the waitress was great on refills and bringing out our food. I would definitely come back next time I'm in Phoenix!

A date picked this restaurant for me and I have to admit I was impressed!  Sitting outside on the patio under the gorgeous sparkling lights on the palm trees, with the sound of the running water in the fountains nearby, in the heart of Central Phoenix.  It didn't even matter at that point if the food was good!   

I've been back several times since and this place doesn't disappoint.  However, I would rank ambiance #1, alcohol #2 and food #3.  Drink choices are widely ranging so everyone will find something.   From your traditional margarita to a cocktail, the drinks are strong and well made.  As for the food, I've had a few dishes I liked - the black and bleu quesadilla and the fajitas tend to be my go-to.  I love the salsa too - it's a chipotle, smoky flavor - my favorite kind!   Best little treat is a white chocolate dessert served in a corn husk at the end of the meal.   Great little inclusion!   

This is located in the Arizona Center by the AMC movie theater, so makes it easy for a great dinner and movie night.   Then grab your date's arm and take a stroll through the courtyard, enjoy the twinkling lights and fountains.   There's no way you'll be able to resist the romance!  =)

So I've been here twice.  Both times, I thought the food was excellent.  Sam's enchiladas, while non-traditional, are admittedly my favorite in town; they are significantly better than Barrio Café.  The portions are huge; the prices, very reasonable; and the atmosphere, especially the beautiful outdoor patio near the fountain, is fantastic on nice Phoenix days.  

And this is all before you consider the chips.  Good gracious, the chips and salsa!  Five star worthy chips and salsa.

My parents and I were so satisfied with this restaurant that i don't even know where to begin.  First off the chips and salsa were amazing.  They had three kinds of chips.  Wonton's, Regular chips, and Sweet potato chips. I got the chimichanga and WOW so freaken gooooood!!!  I would definitely get it again! At the end of the meal they give you a corn husk filled with white chocolate(not a tamale, like everyone keeps saying) which was very quite delightful. Also the setting was so beautiful.  I have never been to a place that gorgeous before and to top it off my parents hate sitting outside but this place they rather of sat outside then inside! lol.

P.S. I went in January of 2012 just forgot to finish my review. =]

Went to a 2:00 show at Herberger Theater. On our walk from parking lot we stopped to eat at Canyon Cafe. Loved the raspberry margarita, variety of chips and enjoyed our tacos. Yummy, felt a rush of happiness. My husband sneezes after a good meal and this actually was a 5 sneezer!

I'm not usually a fan of Mexican food but I did like this place. First, what I ordered: Prickly Pear Margarita, Chicken Pasta, Chocolate Pie, house made chips and guacamole.  The pasta was good and delicious, I just wish I couldn't have taken it home with me and the chocolate pie was to die for. Delicious heaven in your mouth, it was so creamy and good. I shared it with everyone at my table and they fell in love. And for only having one margarita it packed a nice punch and got me pretty tipsy.

I enjoyed the atmosphere and people around. The server was very kind and explained anything we asked of her.  The only downside was the floor was sticky. From the moment I walked in the door and started walking back to the table, I could feel this unusually stickiness under my feet.  Not a big deal once you hit your seat or once you walk out the door.  As long as you're not walking around the place all night then it shouldn't bother you much.  I'm also sure that the sticky floor was a onetime fluke and will probably never happen again should I ever return.

In the end I'd recommend it, it was good food and good service at reasonable prices.

Great find while staying downtown.  Be prepared for extremely slow service.  While you are being seated by the hostess, tell her you want an order of the table made guacamole.  Do this before your waitress comes.  They serve you great chips and salsa but hold off for the guacamole to come if you can as it is fantastic!

The street tacos are the hit here.  My favorite was the carnitas.  There is an option for Rice and Beans but would pass.  It's a tiny plate with a tortilla bowl in the middle with black beans. Richard surrounds it.  Looks cute but the portion is kid size.

Great location and outdoor seating is a must.  Super friendly staff but the only knock is the slow service.

Love this place!!! Came here for lunch yesterday and I about inhaled the entire bowl of chips and salsa :) BEST I HAVE EVER HAD! I was on a quick lunch break so I ordered off the light lunch menu and had a chicken quesadilla, which had carmalized onions and gave it a sweet taste. I will definitely be back! Yum!

4 Stars due to the fact that we requested 2 bowls of the salsa, but additional chips were never brought to the table. Maybe a good thing as I couldn't keep my hands out of the bowl :)

Ok I have always been afraid of chile rellenos as green peppers and I do not always get along, but man the Naked Chile Relleno was, well words can't describe it.

The flavors of the roasted poblano pepper and the salsa makes me want to pack a plate in my suitcase and take it back to Milwaukee. 

I can't wait to retire out here.

The menu may fool you because it really does look completely delicious and enticing. Don't be fooled. I've had more satisfying meals at Chilis. The food was so terribly bland. My margarita was FIFTEEN DOLLARS CAN YOU BELIEVE THAT!? However, the patio is really pretty at night but it's definitely not worth your time.

Good service and friendly staff is the reason why I  gave it 3 stars. The food is the most Americanized Mexican food I've ever had. Don't expect any authentic Mexican food. I mean, it's good, but not great.

Went here for a team lunch during a workday. Food was decent.. Server was ok.. It took about an hour to get our food though so we were getting hangry by the time we actually got our order. Most likely will not be back.

Killer Mexican Food! The chips 'n salsa kicks ass! You get a red, blue & regular tortilla chips with reg, spicy salsa & bean dip! Hellava start! A kick-butt margarita! Had Chicken Fajitas!...THE BEST! ...Cannot wait to return! Great ambiance.......... Move over, Manuels & TEE PEE....ew!
It was so good we went back 3 times during our stay. The chips and salsa are good, but different. Enchiladas were pretty good. Very nice Margaritas!

If you appreciate good food, cocktails, a clean, well-kept restaurant, and quality service you will be disappointed. This used to be a good restaurant, but is completely run down and the food is mediocre, at best. The chicken on the Caesar was terribly dry. The "remoulade" for the crab cake tasted like tartar sauce mixed with French dressing.  The mojito was made with a mix, too sweet to drink.  And the server came to our table of eight with our drinks and called each one out for us to raise our hands. Then she came out with our food and called out our dishes for us to raise our hands.  Really?

As for the atmosphere, the carpet has holes worn in it. The women's bathroom had moldy wood molding and a 3' x 3' hole in the wall covered by a black plastic trash bag taped over it.  As for the awful, old fake plants throughout the restaurant, I don't know what they are thinking. 

I give the extra star for the salsa, everything else was gross.

Owners of this restaurant have no shame and no pride.  I was embarrassed to be the one who recommended my seven friends eat there.
The table side guacamole is a must!  The service was fantastic in the food was very good. The atmosphere, especially sitting outside by a tabletop fire pit, made for the perfect evening.

Fast, friendly service. Started with the complimentary chips and salsa. The salsa was full of bold flavor and color while the tortilla chips were seasoned and had a flaky texture. The combination was an upgrade from the bland chips and tomato juice most Mexican restaurants serve. I followed that up with some chicken enchiladas covered in hatch chile sauce, which came with a side salad and corn salsa in an edible tortilla cup. I noted the great attention to detail and beautiful presentation.  Topped everything off with a white chocolate tamale "on the chef" which was just sweet enough to satisfy that dessert craving. Will stop in again next time I'm in the area!

If I come back to this place it for the freebies and not the entrees. 

To begin, I'm a big fan of Tex Mex and I was really looking forward to eating here. Unfortunately the place didn't live up to expectations but complimentary food you get with every visit softens the blow. 

I ordered the enchiladas and carnitas platter with a cup of the chicken chowder as an appetizer. The soup was pretty average, thick and creamy with big pieces of chicken and even bigger pieces of carrots. Not bad but not really worth ordering again. The platter on the other hand was a disaster. The enchiladas were nothing more than poorly rolled taquitos completely lacking in enchilada sauce sitting on a bed of rice covered in some watered down cheese sauce. Meh! The carnitas were even worse: dry, tough and flavorless, I took two bites and couldn't finish the rest. I really don't know how this plate left the kitchen.

There are some upsides however. The complimentary chips and salsa are delicious. They brought over two big bowls of chips (assortment of sweet potatoes, corn, and plantains) and some home made salsa. Canyon Cafe also brings over some white chocolate/nut desert wrapped in corn husks. A welcome distraction before you see how much $$ they are charging you. Lastly, don't forget the Yelp! check in for a free dessert. We got the cheesecake and it was a massive strawberry coated piece of deliciousness, probably the best part of the dinner. Service friendly and on point.

Overall an ok experience. Worth a second chance.

Jeff,

Thanks for your response but I won't be going to your establishment only to pay and, in return, be berated by a dimwitted, stupid server who tried to humiliate and embarrass me in front of my friends and family.  My previous review didn't go into details about my encounter but you are misinformed.  Your server yelled at me... publicly scold me to leave and refused service (albeit she wanted the rest of my party of 30 to stay) - all due to her unprofessional conduct! I'm not the server; I'm the paying patron.

Had the server done her job and informed me of your state restrictions or simply been more tactful then we wouldn't have had this problem. Instead she created the unnecessary and upsetting confrontation and by attempting to debase and disgrace me. 

She claimed to be a "manager" so she should have known better and I assumed properly trained.  I'd like to think she lied about being a manager rather than think that you hadn't trained your managers properly but that's not the issue. 

As a matter of fact, the server provided multiple pitchers of margaritas and other cocktails simultaneously to the table without questioning the number people sharing the pitcher or anyone's age. Many of my friends were  consuming from the pitchers, other cocktails, inidvidual shots - all in apparent violation of your state's mandate.  

Because it was a large party I paid my bill for our family plus the gratuity however if you'd like rectify your server's misconduct and I'd appreciate a refund for my meal if you're truly sorry for my experience. You can message me directly.
Street tacos were good. Service was quick but it was about 1 pm when we arrived and only a few other tables were occupied.  The outdoor seating by the fountains was nice.
The food is good  nice atmosphere need more on the vegetarian and vegan side on the menu .
Great people great chips and salsa not good tuna

Worst meal I've had in a long time.

Was here on a very slow Tuesday night, there were maybe 10 other patrons. Seated promptly. Our server told my date the specials while I was in the restroom, I got to hear the last one before he walked away. Nice. He returns to take our drink order, repeats it. Walks away. Returns with chips/salsa and my dates beer. No margarita for mama, I think maybe the bartender can't keep up with to 10 people here. Nope. Server forgot. Cuz he's so slammed, right?  We ask for more salsa, which finally comes with my drink. The chips are stale and the salsa is just blah, but we are starving.  After what seems like forever server comes back around offers to get my date another beer. Ignores my empty glass and tells us that our order should be next. 10 minutes later the food arrives. We can immediately tell it's been sitting for a long time. Plate is extremely hot and the food has a thick hard outside, cold in the middle. My meatloaf was dry, hard and flavorless. Potatoes might have been good had they been served within 20 minutes of being ready. My date's meal was also overcooked and bland.

I checked in via yelp and there was a free dessert offer, which I decided against since the rest of the meal sucked. No need to waste my daily calories on more sub par and disappointing food.

Slow/inattentive server+bad food= no return visit for me. Ever.

I think most of the reviews praising the cuisine and service have to be after several of  their "limit 2" margaritas have been consumed.
Best chips and salsa! Friendly service.  Will definitely go back for more!  This was a first time visit for me, and I can't wait to visit again for lunch or dinner.

Pleasant spot for a margarita-filled lunch or dinner. 3.5 stars

Highlights:
- Margaritas: I loved the fruity grand canyon one (lime, prickly pear, etc.) and the hub got an adult version of a milkshake canister with his 2-limit margarita (got 4 glasses out of that thing!)
- Outside/inside seating: outside was nice on a patio especially at night overlooking some blue lit up trees and misters for the heat, but inside was a nice A/C haven for the height of the sunny day.
- Chips: combo of sweet wontony, yellow corn, orange spiced, and blue corn as well as sweet potato chips. It's rare to find such variety.
- Salsa: great roasted flavor
- Pork: carnitas was a large portion of meat--quite juicy and tasty
- Menu: pure mex and southwestern mex as well as pastas and salads
- Dessert: creative presentation with white chocolate pecans enveloped in a tamale wrapper. Complementary item which was a nice touch.
- Staff: super duper friendly which I appreciated

Lowlights:
- Crabcake: too dense cornmealy for me--couldn't taste much flavor or crab
- Fish: didn't taste too fresh and advertised that veggies would be in the mix, but only limited slivers to were found.

Decent spot. I'd come again for chips and margaritas.

Went to Canyon Cafe on a recommendation when the call went out for authentic Mexican. Well, this place is not what you would call authentic. More like Tex-Mex I would say. Went here on a Sunday afternoon and seating was immediate. The server was really great! She was personable, knowledgeable about the menu, and pretty darn cute to boot! We got the table side guacamole to start which went over very well. Tacos were had by everyone including a special request that the kitchen had no problem filling. I got the grilled chicken tacos and they were pretty good. I put a fair amount of hot sauce on them but the flavors were very good. A nice place to stop in downtown Phoenix.

Let me just tell you, that this was BY FAR the BEST meal of my entire Phoenix stay. Great food, affordable prices, and an amazing happy hour. Kirsten the bartender was totally awesome, definitely try to hit up the bar when she's there!

Sam's cafe was a nice place to go for lunch or Dinner and enjoy some Tex~Mex if your in the downtown area. They are conveniently located on 3rd not far from the convention center.  The Tex~Mex Decor was sorta fun with a small bar area near the front and a huge patio along the park side of the restaurant.   

The service was a bit slow but they were very busy for lunch.  I think everyone at our table had salads, all were A~OK.  Their Cobb salad was rated the best at our table.  The Blacken steak taco salads were lacking steak and and other veggies would have been nice too in addition to just lettuce, cheese and diced pieces of steak.  The Cobb was full of everything your would expect with a good Cobb salad and was very tasty.  The Chicken taco salad was better than the steak.

The chips and salsa at first appeared to be very impressive as many other Yelpers have mentioned however your either a fan or not a fan.  I'm not a fan unfortunately...  The chips were too greasy with way too much of their seasoning!  I especially did not like their salsa.  It had no heat and HUGE chunks of tomato's! YYYEEAA~UCK.  Way too much work to get to the little bits of salsa that were actually kind of good.  I asked for a different salsa, my server just brought us some hot sauce to add to the salsa. Some of folks at our table did like their chips and salsa though. The Grand Canyon Margaritas were very good and a recommend from me to you.  

Suggestion: seek out the "Info-dude" that walks around the Mall area to show people where to go and ask him for some coupons. We were able to get 20% off our meal coupons from him.  Based on their margaritas and a few other Yelp reviews I'm looking forward to my next visit but will order something different.

Really not that impressed by Canyon Cafe. My work recently moved downtown to our corporate headquarters building, so I am trying out all kinds of new restaurants in the area. Sadly, Canyon Cafe just doesn't cut it. I ordered the carnitas plate which came with meat, fajita veggies, rice, beans and tortillas. The meat was tender but bland, the fajita veggies were not cooked thoroughly (I expect fajitas veggies to be crispy and fresh off the grill), the rice was mediocre. The beans and tortillas were the best part of the plate. My coworker got the ahi tuna southwestern salad and he rated it 4/5 stars.

The best part of my meal was the white chocolate nut dessert that comes with your check. It's wrapped up in a corn husk and looks as good as it tastes!

One highlight: free dessert if you check in on Yelp! I got the chocolate cake to go. It was super rich and basically a huge block of fudge. The crust was tasty but I hardly ate any of the cake itself.

4 stars for service and convenience, 2 stars for food, 2 stars for dessert (even though it was free). I probably won't be back.

Amazing. Top notch Service the black and blue cheese quesadilla is to die for and the queso dip with artichoke hearts as well! Great service beautiful setting and atmosphere you can sit outside with the heaters on. Truly an amazing place to eat. The attention to detail they have is stunning.
This place was awsome!!  The hotel I stayed at recommended it & I was definitely grateful. Great food, great service!!  I highly recommend it too!  Enjoy!

The food here is fresh and delicious. Your pallet is guaranteed to go wild with the flavors. I had the Bison Meatloaf yesterday and the BBQ was the best I've had. I returned the next day and had the "Naked" Chile Relleno. All I can say, it didn't disappoint. Our server, Topeaka, was attentive and gave great recommendations when we asked. The Traditional Margarita on the rocks was superb. 

I was here fo a conference and when I'm in town, I will certainly make a stop here!  Highly recommend eating outside.

The bartender Kirsten was outstanding. Kept a great conversation and made my friends and I feel welcome while we are in Phoenix visiting. Had to come back here twice just for happy hour. Took care of us and definitely made my experience here memorable. Thanks Kirsten!

I cannot speak highly enough of this restaurant. The chips are to die for, the salads and tortilla soup were awesome. To top it off, the service by our waitress TJ (Tammy J) was excellent as she made us feel like guests in her own home. We'll go back again anytime we visit Phoenix.

Our new favorite place to dine! We have a difficult  time deciding what to order on the large and tempting Southwestern menu. The appetizers are also fabulous...the fried calamari is the best, served with a creamy spicy dipping sauce... large portion....enough for two as a meal. The prices are reasonable and the staff have become our friends. The surrounding outdoor area is beautiful, with fountains and twinkly lit trees. The cafe is located in the Arizona Center so a nice place to walk and shop after dinner.
Ask any ASK ME AMBASSADOR (those guys in orange are great and know what's best in Phoenix) and they will direct you to Sam's.

Came in for the first time at lunch and sat on the patio. It's a large beautiful patio that overlooks a pretty garden area in the courtyard. Nice large restaurant. A ton of great menu options and good drink menu. The margaritas are strong and made with quality ingredients so they limit you to 2.

They start with fresh made chips and salsa. Salsa is homemade with a roasted flavor. It's not Spicy but very flavorful. The chips were amazing!! They are actually a assortment of flour tortilla chips, corn chips, sweet potato chips, and wonton chips. It was fun and creative to try all the different flavors. The sweet potato chips were like candy, so good! 

I got the Southwest Cobb salad and it was amazing. Large with a ton of toppings. Everything tasted so fresh and packed with flavor. The blackened chicken was very tasty. My friend got the sante fe stuffed chicken breast and she loved it, it looked delicious too. 

They serve these white chocolate and pecan wrapped in a corn husk for free with your bill. Tasty treat at the end of the meal. 

The service was okay but the food was amazing and you could taste the quality ingredients. I would definitely recommend and love to come back. Thank you!

Pros: great chips and salsa! Veggie tacos were very tasty. Ambience on outdoor patio is great.
Cons: the service. I think our server was just too busy with three other relatively big tables . She took our order, delivered the first round of drinks, and then never saw her again. Not until we were almost finished with our meal. I was able to flag down the hostess for the waters and more chips and salsa. She was helpful and asked if she could get us anything else. We also had to see the hostess for our bill. 
The pork carnitas taco was really dry and the bison taco was average at best. 

Just too many other good places in the area to eat.

Food was OK.  I had the enchiladas and they were good. The rice was also great. the chips and salsa were horrible in m opinion. The salsa was slightly sweet and the chips were a mixture of different types of chips. While this was unique.. it wasn't good. On the flip side my food came out in about 5 minutes. My server was good also.

Good Lord, it's so annoying when a business has an ineffective social media presence. 

I've been trying to write a favorable review for Canyon Café for ages, and every time I go to answer a question for myself, I stumble into their social media circle of death.

Their Website: Outdated.

Facebook: More like an online journal than a business website. 579 Likes. No recent posts. Mostly my photos from previous visits.

Press: Two old propaganda "articles;" one from New Times and one from DTPHX; and one random blogger piped in several years ago to say they liked their multicolored chips.

Twitter/Instagram: ??

But why is their website and social media important to your Yelp restaurant review? Why? W H Y??

I'll tell you why: The owners don't care enough to invest in their own company's public image; they're not on top of their game; something's amiss, but what?

According to their website, "at the end of 2002, Bruce Lazarus and Doug Czufin led a small group of dedicated managers and chefs from the large public company and began operating a small private company..."

Ugh, what?!? What large public company? What small private company? Which chefs? What are you talking about?

Well, I'll tell you. Canyon Café Acquisition Company LLC, is a former subsidiary of Avado Brands Inc. It seems that the website is suggesting that Canyon Café is somehow better because it's now held by smaller company than it was previously held by, yet it's held by a company dedicated to acquisitions. And, as a side note, plenty of great restaurants are held by big corporations, but whatever, you do you, Canyon Café.

It goes on to say, "...that's what the Southwest is all about..."

But according to their website, they have locations in Missouri. Is Missouri the Southwest?

Then it randomly says, "visit our sister restaurant 1130 The Restaurant at the AZ Center," with no links nor explanation.

Ok, but HOW'S the restaurant? How's their food?

THE STORY & SERVICE EXPERIENCE

My friends and I have been going to the Arizona Ultimate Women's Expo at the Phoenix Convention Center for years, and depending on what food/restaurant they want to try, that's what we do. 

And one of those times, they picked Canyon Café.

Canyon Café is in a SUPER pretty location. The courtyard, with the mature palms and water fountains, are delightful. Also, the architecture is lovely. They also have a very cozy patio setup.

We sat at the bar, and although it wasn't packed, the service wasn't fast.

The chips were indeed multicolored, and the salsa seemed scratch-made. I preferred the fresh guacamole.

I'm all about the frozen mango margaritas. They were very good, albeit a tad watery.

We also tried their chicken quesadilla, which I liked very much. I'm a sucker for cheese melted on a tortilla, and folded over.

The server/bartender was pleasant, not fast, and not memorable in general: Break even.

CONCLUSION

I can't see how this business stays alive, other than from the weekday downtown crowd and the Phoenix Convention Center traffic.

The atmosphere is the best part.

Canyon Café is good, but not specifically seek it out good.

4/5 RECOMMEND 

OF NOTE

*Locations: San Antonio, Texas, St. Louis, Missouri, and Phoenix, Arizona.

*Parking is dreadful. Good luck.

*For more information: canyoncafe.com

Well for starters, I will say I had given up on going out for dinner so I ate a couple slices of warmed over pizza. We finally went and as I was less than hungry skipped the steak I had been eying. We split a Meatloaf and switched the mashed potatoes out for the mashed sweet potatoes. The two split plates were more than enough food for a regular meal. I can't imagine eating a whole one and I am a hearty eater. We also each ordered a Rico Rita. Yummy and again large portions. The service was good too. I used to go to the Camelback location and the quality and service is the same here. We will be back.

We ate here for the first time on May 18th. What a great find! We received tickets to see Diary of Anne Frank so stopped here first.

The chips and salsa were brought to the table initially upon sitting along with getting our drink order. We loved the smokey deep taste of the salsa but the chips not so much, although we ate them. They were a combination of flour and corn and had seasoning on them. I asked about getting some without seasoning and was told that was how they were served. Would have liked them better without seasoning. Ordered the table side guacamole and it was so delicious! Chunky and flavorful!

I ordered the tortilla soup, which was so good.  Rich broth, big chunks of chicken along with tortilla strips.  Partner had the carnitas, which we will definitely be back for!  Tortillas wrapped in corn husks, along with rice and beans.  Neither of cared for the black beans...found them too salty.  The rice was ok as well, full of taste and flavor (cumin I believe).  But the pork...so juicy and flavorful. Also comes with onions and peppers...the whole dish was so good.

Took advantage of the check in deal for dessert and we ordered the Tres Leches cake.  So good, rich, and yummy and was served with a strawberry sauce that just added to the entire experience. 

Service was great and we really enjoyed sitting on the outside patio!  We will be back and will recommend.  Why the four stars?  Beans too salty and not having the ability to get the chips without seasoning on them.

Great experience!!!!

Highly recommended by the hotel I was staying at, my colleagues and I decided to try this restaurant for a "Phoenix experience"

The chips and salsa we started with were seasoned uniquely and delicious. Our pitcher of margarita was good too.

Entrees are big and nicely plated. I got the special, a sesame tuna with squash noodles. The tuna could have been a little more rare to my taste but the noodles made of squash were yummy.

The indoor/outdoor atmosphere was great.

Highly recommended!

The chips in this place are ridiculously good!  I literally ate an entire basket myself.  We stopped here for drinks and an appetizer and were thoroughly impressed.  The Guac itself was decent, the presentation of it was really good.  I was a big fan of this place and would go back in a hurry.  One thing to be aware of is the fact that the advertisements for drink specials on the sidewalk are a little misleading, as they are only valid in the really small bar area.  Next time, I will be sure to grab my drink first in the bar area for the discounted price before I sit down.  Enjoy!

Came here for a break from working like a mad woman.  M and I met up!  Had an early dinner.  M got dinner and I got an appetizer.  I got the wings.  They were done, crispy and flavorful.  A little messy but good!

Service was great an the chips are good!!!!!
Sweet potato chips .  Chicken chowder  .  Mango margarita .  Everything was really good.  Service awesome & free desert with Check in. Can't beat it!

Enjoyed a Sunday afternoon Happy Hour here this weekend before catching a flight back to the Bay Area. I was with two friends who live nearby and enjoyed their company as much as I enjoyed the pretty view from the outdoor patio of Canyon Café. 

I was in Arizona for the Ragnar Relay so most of the places I saw were on foot or looking out the window of a minvan. This was really the only afternoon of my vacation that I had to rest and relax and see the town. 

Service was terrific. Saul (I think that's what he said) was very attentive and brought us some delicious chips to start and even a wonderful white chocolate tomale dessert at the end. We had $4 margaritas and one iced tea as we sat by the unlit firepit. Everything was perfect! I would definitely return here next time I visit friends or run another out-of-state race.

This is a perfect low key relaxing restaurant with great southwest food outside the usual tacos, fajitas, etc.  I sat outdoors today and there were kids present but it was quiet, and relaxing.  I ordered the southwest Caesar salad which was a perfect variation on a classic.  I then received my entree the Santa Fe stuffed chicken breast.  So flavorful and huge!  The asparagus was cooked perfectly.  I also got a free dessert for checking in on yelp.  There are small remnants of the previous Sams cafe but it's the good things.  Staff is friendly and low key.
The food was ok. It was good, definitely not bad. I was just expecting a bit more of a southwestern flavor.
The food was bland, the cheese dip reminded me of cheese wiz and after seated I waited over 15 minutes just to give my drink order.  The only good thing was the chips...not going back.

this place was in a small little shopping area across from our hotel.

Service was outstanding, food was great, they do not skimp on portion sizes, better come hungry

A very good choice for our first night in Phoenix
Food was good. Tell the chef that u do not serve a closed shellfish. And tell the waitress, veronica, that u can't eat pasta with a spoon. Staff could've been better

Fairly decent upscale Southwestern spot.  Great margaritas and nice outdoor dinning area.  The enchilidas were good, although I think I prefer the preparation at an authentic Mexican restaurant.

The fried wonton "tortilla" chips and salsa were an excellent starter.

Came here on a Saturday for lunch and it was eerily quiet and empty until about 2:30pm. 

It was hard to find for my first time in Phoenix and at this mall. The construction really threw me off. 

This place boasts a Sonoran style of food. Not quite TexMex, not quite Mexican - something for the American taste buds in between.

I got the fish tacos, which were spicy and flavorful. I didn't care for the side salad - it was bitter. But I liked adding the side salsa for extra texture. 

The chips and salsa were fun, though I prefer traditional corn chips and these tasted too much like an off-brand of Doritos. 

The table salsa didn't feel worth the price tag for me, but it was okay.

This seems like a fun place to go for happy hour, or with a large group to sit on the beautiful patio. Give it a shot, don't expect anything to taste "authentic", and check in for a free dessert while it lasts! Definitely recommend the tres leches.

After reading all the other reviews of this place I have determined one thing. You all were obviously on crack when you ate here. Or maybe they gave you crack when you ate here...either way my experience was not the same.

Went at about 4:00 on a Saturday, not a busy time for a restaurant so I wasn't scared away when we were the only ones in the entire place, next time, I'll make sure to think twice.

They started us off with chips and salsa, and I'm rather shocked that no one has mentioned their chips are a total fail. Salsa was decent, but the chips were an assortment of sweet potato chips, stale blue corn chips, sweet fried chips (sugar and everything), and stale normal tortilla chips. All in one bowl. If they weren't stale, the blue corn and normal chips would have paired nicely with the salsa. But rubbery sweet potato (don't get me wrong, I like sweet potato)  and sugar coated with salsa? Really?

We decided that we were going to order an appetizer and then a meal to split, and I love a good artichoke-anything so I ordered the artichoke dip. When it came out (like 20 minutes later) I had to ask them if they brought us the right dish. It was a bowl of queso and no matter how hard I searched, there was not an artichoke to be found. They didn't bring us any other chips to go with it, and let me tell you, sweet potato chips and queso don't go so great together. To make it worse, the menu said it was $6.99 but they charged us $7.79, if it was good I wouldn't have cared so much about $0.80 as I do.

I thought a good beef fajita dish with a cup of chicken tortilla soup would be a safe bet, but they couldn't even do that right. They brought out corn and flour tortillas with the fajitas. Word of advice, if they ask you which you prefer save yourself the trouble and get the flour. The corn ones were so wet that they literally tore to shreds when I tried to peel them off each other. There wasn't a whole lot of beef in the beef fajitas either, and what was there was lacking in good flavor. And for the soup, Half Moon Sports Grill makes a better tortilla soup than this place...and they're a sports grill. 

Overall, food was bad. Service was very slow considering we were the only ones there, and I would never, ever eat here again. Did I mention they didn't give us silverware? We had to go steal it off another table.

To start off, the decor in this restaurant was so amazing. The chips and salsa that was brought out had to be the best I have ever had! We ordered the appetizer with the 3 different options and all of it was so tasty!

Average food in a convenient location. I would probably return if they had cheaper dishes but sure to it's location, it's a bit overpriced.

I really enjoyed the complimentary assorted seasoned chips. It had flavorful corn, flour, blue and sweet potato chips! The salsa was just average though, which is a bummer. 

I ordered the special of the day which was green pork stew. The pork wasn't very tender but I liked the flavor. It had hominy an the rest was soup-like. It came with flour tortillas and black beans. I wish it had rice too.

Husband ordered grilled chicken tacos. He didn't really enjoy it because it wasn't like a traditional taco, but I thought it was okay. It had pieces of grilled chicken with shredded cabbage, picked onion and something like a Chipotle sauce. The rice was underwhelming which was disappointing. 

I would probably return if I was really hungry and I had no where else to go. The decor is nice but the food and service was average only.

The outdoor area was great to sit in during a warm summer evening.  The service was attentive, even though we were the only ones sitting outside.  The complimenatry chips are terrific -- they are a mix of a bunch of different types, not just stale tortilla chips that you may get elsewhere.  The entrees were solid (not earth-shattering), but in light of the other positive aspects, the four stars are well deserved.
Loved this atmosphere at canyon. Lit up patio and patio heaters, good food and very relaxing.

This is a great place for happy hour.   I do believe these were the best chips and salsa I have ever had.  They have a bit of a kick.  Be careful though, they are definitely hard to stop eating and you will spoil your appetitie.  The fried shrimp tacos were fabulous.  I would have definitely ventured back if it wasn't for the lady bartender's bad attitude and poor customer service.  The manager  Angel was nice enough to give my co-workers and I gift cards for our next purchase there.  Not sure I would go back though.

I had never heard of this place when i went here for a lunch meeting.  We arrived about noon on a Wednesday and the place was busy, but not packed.  The weather outside was awesome and we wanted to sit outside but the noise from the fountains/waterfalls up against the patio was really loud to talk over so we sat inside.  

The chips and salsa they brought out was amazing.  The bowl had 4 different types and flavors of chips and the salsa had a good taste and spice without being too hot.  For a meal i picked the Meatloaf and it was a ton of food.  2 huge pieces meatloaf that was seared on a grill after it was cooked came out with corn & mashed potatoes and a roasted tomato BBQ sauce.  I ate the whole thing (even though it was more food that i should have eaten) and i didn't feel bad!.  The meeting was a little hard to pay attention to though since the windows faced the pathway and the women from ASU downtown and all of the businesses kept walking by!!!
Cheesecake I ordered had fungus on it! I didn't even want the cheesecake, I asked for the Banana Burrito and they ran out of that. Definitely a disappointment

We stumbled upon Canyon Cafe because it was extremely convenient- located across from my hotel in the Arizona Center.  Because of that, and the fact that they have a wonderful large outdoor patio (perfect in March), we wound up here two nights in a row, even though we found the food, drinks, and service mediocre.  Group decision, not a personal preference to return.

First thing, both nights, the service was Extremely Slow.  It's annoying when multiple servers/bussers walk by without even a 'someone will be right with you'.  On our second visit, the hostess actually stopped to ask us if anyone had been over after 15 minutes sitting at our table without any wait staff talking to us.  We must have looked irked.

Secondly, they limit you to 2 margaritas, so they should be fantastic, but we all found them to be incredibly inconsistent in taste and alcohol strength.  Out of the 4 margaritas I personally had over two nights; 1 was Fantastic, one was overly strong, 1 tasted like a virgin, and 1 was just okay.

As for the actual food, the chips they serve with the chips and salsa were an interesting and cool mix of yellow and blue corn tortilla, sweet potato (my fav), wonton (second fav), and flour tortillas with a dry seasoning (next fav).  The salsa was meh, but the untraditional chips didn't even need it.  This was the best part of the meal.

I had the chicken fajitas night 1.  The chicken was really dry and had an abundance of unnecessary seasoning on it.  The accouterments were just standard.  I ordered the steak/shrimp fajitas night 2.  The steak was very good but the shrimp was tasteless.

All in all, I cannot see why I would ever return to this restaurant.
-1.. They closed early and are not reliable. Don't  going there. The staff closes up early and people who drove from Vegas to check out the #1 yelp restaurant. Never going back.

I wish we could do 3 1/2 stars. I do think the food here is very good and the atmosphere is phenomenal but I don't think it's worth four stars.
But I'm going to give them four stars because that was my first time there and the rest the food that others were having around me look very good as well. Started the evening with a wonderful combination of different kinds of chips and a great salsa and a good house margarita.  I had the pecan salmon very good but under cooked and I wasn't there for sushi. I have attached the pictures And they say at all. Interesting combinations in flavors with in the dish. And salmon for $20 anywhere with all the sides that it came with in a nice dining experience is a good deal. Waitress was very nice and will definitely go back to try more dishes.

Went in with a couple of friends for a post-softball tournament drink.  Didn't get served for quite a while; all we had on our table were the menus and the chips/salsa.  No water?!

When we ordered our drinks, we got the typical "you're not ordering anything else tonight?/Well, I guess I'd better go work some other tables for a bigger tip" vibe from our waitress.  So what? Serve ALL of your customers the same and you'll be compensated.  Silly.

Yummy margaritas, though.  Chips and salsa don't QUITE compare to Aunt Chilada's, but they were better than most (ahem...chain restaurants...).

I have been to this wonderful place a couple of times now and have had the most delicious dinners and lunches always.  Last night I invited a friend to have dinner here for her 1st time and she was raving all night about the crab cake dinner she had to eat.  The service is always terrific and our server "Keith W" did an outstanding job (thank you , Keith) making my friends 1st time there a memorable one!  Thanks to all the staff!

this place is decent. the service was great. there is a nice outside patio surrounded by trees lit up with pretty blue lights. the food was good; i had the shrimp quesadilla. my fave was the rico rita drink. they have a 2 drink max policy on this drink b/c it's supposed to get you soooooo wasted and um well i assure you i am not an alki but this drink did nothing of the sort. but it was very tasty! i will try to make this at home :P 

i would recommend if you're in the az shopping centre but i wouldn't go out of my way to eat there.

Best vegetarian fajitas we've ever had! The seasoning was amazing on them...the guacamole handmade, the sour cream freshly whipped. Easily made vegan...the flavor is good that you don't need the cream or cheese...not often the case with fajitas.They even put the beans on the skillet too so those tasted delicious too...beans are cooked in vegetable broth.

Both times we've been here, I've had the sangria...delicious! Queso dip very good. The salsa bar during happy hour is yummy--FREE chips/salsa! Kids' menu includes cheesy noodles that were really good too. Service is fast and friendly. Outdoor area is comfortable and shaded.

Whoever made the menu items vegetarian-friendly did a fantastic job of making the dishes very flavorful--a must for cooking without meat. This is one of our favorite places to eat now! A pre-movie dinner at the Arizona Center...beats Esplanade hands down.

Had a group business dinner here while in PHX.  If you are out of town the location can be a tricky as it is inside a shopping plaza.  Most of the group was about 10 mins late (I know I know...sad when most of us have GPS capable mobile phones).  We found it due to the friendly local police and Downtown Phoenix greeters (?).  

The restaurant did not have a private room (we had a group of 15) but we were there really early.  The chip basket is AMAZING!  It has a bunch of different chips from tortilla, to different types of potates and even these fried pieces of goodness (that reminded me of wontons).  The salsa was really good too.  The waitstaff was great....they provided lots of these chip baskets during our 3 hour meeting.  When the meeting concluded...it was straight to the top shelf margaritas which we've been dying for since we sat down.  It's a great deal for top shelf tequila and the quantity.  You get about 2-4 drinks as they even give you some reserve in the cocktail shaker.  

Food was good.  I had the sirloin which was cooked perfect at medium.  My friend sitting next to me ordered the same thing at medium rare but got it well done.  She sent it back and after a few minutes got a new one closer to the rare side but she was happy.

If I lived in the area and was able to visit again I could consider becoming a fan of this place.  Definitely check it out.  Another plus - they have a patio too!

Street tacos!!!! Margaritas!!! Get the Orange Beso Margarita and the street tacos. I get 3 tacos with no beans and rice. So far my favorite tacos are the spicy chicken and the Poblano Chili tacos. I tried the shrimp one. It was kind of bland compared to the other two. Husband had the gi-normous Cobb salad and really liked it.
Walking by and checked out the menu and decided to give it a try. I'm very glad I did. The service is great and prompt. The food was so yummy. And I recommend the limit 2 Margaritas!

Not very busy on a Monday night. Recommended by hotel concierge. The chips/salsa were ok, but not worth the calories. The table-made guacamole was likewise unremarkable. I think the avocados were still not fully ripe. The calamari was the worst I ever had - fishery and tough. A table of 7 hungry guys didn't finish either appetizer. The main courses were all pretty good. I had the grilled tuna. A bit overdone (scalding hot plate is always a sign that it sat under the heat lamp too long), but flavorful. Overall, ok but I'd probably look for someplace else next time I'm in town.

This place has the best outdoor seating!! GM Tony and Manager Richard are so attentive, kind and social!! If you want a great drink Amanda or Kristin can make you one, two or three:) If you haven't been.....you're missing out!!

This place tucked in a business building off Black Canyon Hwy (in the Revana building) is a hidden gem! There are delicious smells coming from the front door.
